text: Backed by the glow of compu-screens, a half-glimpsed alie A PREDATOR -- watches the receding ARK through a viewport (NOTE: we see him mostly in shadow, full reveal to come).
Emergency lights illuminate a dank, organic-looking interior. CAMERA MOVES PAST:
Around the periphery. FROST clouds the cryotubes, prevent from seeing the “passengers.” Finally, CAMERA ARRIVES AT

The pilot of this crippled ship. We do not see him fully either, but for the record? This is our “GOOD” PREDATOR.” HIS TALONS dance across a control panel; a shrill beep..! Predator symbols, but we get the idea: ERROR--ERROR--ERRO Our Predator TAPS more controls. Feverish. Until --
A final tether COMES LOOSE, venting PLASMA energy, and --  Through the viewport, the Ark is enveloped by a BLINDING LIGHT -- then a SWIRL OF PARTICLE ENERGY, as we --

STARFIELD. Silence. Then -- THE ARK DROPS out of hyperspace. SHUDDERS into a NEW ORBI Approaching what is, in fact, A DYING PLANET. Ice caps melting; atmosphere toxified; the dominant species continually finding new ways to fuck things up. Oddly, the only planet in our solar system not named afte a God: Earth.
SPARKS, gagging smoke... Our Predator realizes he’s on a sinking ship... He programs a new command sequence;

of the CRYOTUBES. A SCROLLING COUNTDOWN, commenced -- in Predator symbols. A self destruct sequence..? One last thing: The Predator taps the panel again -- and a SLOT OPENS, revealing A DEVICE like a Steampunk TV remote. This is the KUJHAD. Remember it. He extracts it from its slot and -- K-CHK! SNAPS IT into own WRIST COMPUTER. Then he rises urgently, and...

The ARK SHUDDERS, penetrating earth’s atmosphere, as: WHO AN ESCAPE POD, JETTISONED... From the main body of the craft. A series of RIPPLING SHIMMERS engulf it, and before our eyes, it auto-engages STEALTH CAMOUFLAGE -- and VANISHES. Pause. Then... a rising swell of JUNGLE NOISES... It begi

Rugged face. Stubble. He’s looking down, eyes red-rimmed with fatigue, as we HEAR: A hollow TRICKLE of piss in plastic. He finishes. Screws the top back on a thermos. Then lower it, where it DANGLES ON A THIN NYLON LINE because we are

WITH THE SOLDIER, perched in a gnarled tree... THIRTY FEE OFF THE GROUND. He shifts in his “nest.” Brings to bear an M24 sniper rifle. Meet LIEUTENANT QUINN McKENNA, 30s. On the BACK of his hand... a faded (yet prominent) CRESCENT SCAR. Souvenir of another fight.

WE HEAR a TALKIE SQUELCH -- then a tinny voice from his Bluetooth headset: HAINES’ TALKIE VOICE (filtered) Piggy One, copy. (beat) Piggy One, this is Piggy Two, do you copy? MCKENNA (into headset mike) I was peeing. Do you mind..? ANOTHER RADIO VOICE joins the conversation, filtered: DUPREE’ S TALKIE VOICE Piggy Three. I have a question, over.

Cut the chatter. He cracks his neck, then adjusts his scope. DUPREE’S TALKIE VOICE Seriously. If you’re the one that went to market, right? That means Haines and me, we get to choose between the roast beef and the staying home. Right?
Dupree, I swear to God -- McKenna presses his eye to the rifle sight.

A MANSION. Neoclassical. Built in the 1850s, but painted hot Havana aquamarine. Surrounded by high walls and roaming SENTRIES. You guessed it: A DRUG LORD’S COMPOUND. DUPREE’S TALKIE VOICE I just wanna be the stay home piggy, that’s all I’m saying. HAINES’ TALKIE VOICE McKenna. We got a problem. McKenna tenses.

What is it? HAINES’ TALKIE VOICE You can’t be the one who went to market. You already went wee wee wee. McKenna shakes his head; he’s so over these assholes. He wipes away sweat, SWIVELS the rifle, SEEING:
On the DIRT ROAD leading into the compound. BLACK SUVs.
(all business) Eyes north. HAINES’ TALKIE VOICE I see it.

Stay sharp. Ranging now. He presses his eye to the scope, PANNING WITH: THE SUVs As they stop, dust rising. DRUG SOLDIERS besiege the vehicles -- roughly PULLING OUT several HOSTAGES with pillow cases over their heads.  A MAN in a silk shirt appears. The DRUG LORD faces the sagging hostages, contemptuous. His men raise their weapo
(CONT’D) (into com) Target in the reticle, no cross wind. I’m not waiting, 10-50 out.

As he slowly, silently, FLICKS the safety catch. He cente the Drug Lord’s head in the crosshairs. Stops breathing. All in all, a pretty crappy time for an EARTHQUAKE. A deep bass RUMBLE, coming from... where? Above? As, utterly without warning -- THE TOP OF THE DRUG LORD’S MANSION -- SHEARED OFF BEFORE OUR EYES. A TSUNAMI of debris, blown loose. EXPELLED -- Whatever caused it, it’s headed right AT MCKENNA. He DROPS the rifle; GRABS his combat knife to CUT HIMSELF LOOSE -- TUMBLES, as the canopy of green ERUPTS--! CUT TO BLACK.
Amid sudden SILENCE. On his side now, face in the dirt...

Showing that the UFO just effectively PUNCHED A TUNNEL in the jungle, strewn with smoking debris and pulped branche He blinks. No telling how long he was out. A minute? An hour? He looks up, keys his headset: MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Piggy Team, do you copy? In his ear, only STATIC. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Goddammit, COPY! Still: nothing but STATIC. McKenna stumbles to his feet. Feeling exposed. Trees, aflame. Smoke everywhere. Exhales raggedly, all too aware he’s squarely in
left by the spacecraft. Only now, he’s SEEING:
It lies hissing, spitting. Swamped in plant matter. He eases to a halt. Wary. Sights through
And we notice, first off -- the HATCH. It’s open, steam curling from inside. He stalks forward, past the muddy, smoking IMPACT CRATER. Looks down. Frowns:

On the ground. Lying amidst them, something we recognize: A Predator WRIST GAUNTLET. Discarded? Jarred loose? Beside it, he notices something else: a tiny metal DEVICE that resembles a trilobite. A CLOAKING BALL. McKenna stoops -- palms the alien-looking device... HEARS VOICES. He DIVES behind a fallen LOG. Snaps the rifle to his shoulder, sights downrange. 300 yards -- People are swarming out of the drug mansion. Fuck. He nervously juggles the metal BALL.... absently depresse a SWITCH (an electronic HUM) -- He looks left -- all clear. Glances over his shoulder. Looks to his RIGHT -- ohmyfuckingGod. Jumps a foot. A FUCKING PREDATOR. Two feet away -- and it wasn’t there a SECOND AGO. He scrambles backward, blinks: The PREDATOR, stock still. No reaction. Simply lies there, all eight feet of it. Its MASK askew. We realize: He’s been there ALL ALONG. McKenna merely DE-CLOAKED him. He holds his breath, cautious not to wake the sleeping beast. That said, he can’t resist. Licks his lips, reaches... cautiously LIFTS the dislodged BATTLE MASK worn by the Predator. Looks down, blanching - At the insectile craziness this thing calls a FACE.  MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Fuck me. He dry-washes his face with his hand. Scans the alien tec -- mask, gauntlet. Evidence. With quick, practiced moves, STASHES them in his pack -- MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Sorry, bud. Without these, no one’s gonna believe me. He starts to go, STOPS. Looks back, says softly: MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Welcome to earth, brother. Just so you know..? (lights up) It only gets worse from here. He turns. RUNS... As he leaves frame, CAMERA settles on the hulking, sprawled PREDATOR -- Its EYES SNAP OPEN. EXT. JUNGLE - WITH McKENNA - DAY Moving through the overgrowth. Sudden CRACKLE of radio chatter: HAINES’ TALKIE VOICE (0.S.) Repeat: switch to 30-30, Dupree, do you copy? THEY'RE BACK ONLINE. Bingo. McKenna stops, keys his walki
Piggy Two, respond, over. HAINES’ TALKIE VOICE McKenna, is that you? Now DUPREE’S voice joins in: DUPREE’ S TALKIE VOICE Hi, guys. Can I just say - - holy shit?
We’re blown. Move out, converge for extraction. HAINES’ VOICE Copy that. I have visual on Dupree, I -- what the fuck..?  McKenna freezes.
Did not copy that. Talk to me, Haines. HAINES’ VOICE I... There’s something moving... (beat) Dupree, break left, break left--!
Talk to me, what’s happening??

head_text.subj: A RATTLE OF MACHINE GUN FIRE

text: A series of strangled HUMAN SCREAMS. HE DOESN’T NEED

head_text.subj: THE WALKIE, HE CAN HEAR THEM --

text: McKenna CHARGES BACK in the direction he just came from. He SNAPS his rifle to his shoulder; TEARING through the brush. HEARTBEAT thudding in his ears... as: A NEW SOUND, NOW -- RISING. A low, bass THUMPING -- WHUP-WHUP-WHUP. He looks up, SEES

Inbound, range 500 meters. What the hell? Skimming the treeline... on a bee-line for the Drug Lord’s compound. McKenna frowns: his extraction..? No. Impossible. Wrong helicopter. He heaves to his feet, switches on his mic: MCKENNA (INTO MIC) (CONT’D) Mayday. TIC in process. Bogey inbound. AH-6 Little Bird, BLACK, no markings. Who sent these gu-- The chopper UNLEASHES TWO AIR-TO-SURFACE ROCKETS. A sudden, sky-high whooosh... McKenna, AGAPE -- They come vectoring in, remorseless. DETONATE--! Say goodbye to the mansion. The sentries. The Drug Lord. And his Soldiers. AND the Hostages. All gone in one horrendous, volcanic SECOND -- Pretty much the job McKenna came here to do. Except no prisoners, no witnesses, no mercy.  Scorched. Fucking. Earth. The chopper BANKS sharply, coming in for a landing. BLACK CLAD MERCS, already leaning out the sides...
Debris pelting down around him. Stumbling, gun up -- Bursts through a thicket into a clearing --

head_text.subj: BACK WHERE HE LEFT THE PREDATOR

text: But no Predator. Just a sea of blood. THE REMAINS OF TWO SOLDIERS; dressed like McKenna. Same camo face paint, jungle khakis. His men. McKenna spins, gun tracking. Sights down the barrel:

From the helicopter. Headed his way. No way out. McKenna looks to his team; shredded. EVISCERA Draws a shuddering breath... BOLTS. Deeper into the jungle -- leaving them behind, as the scene, from everywhere and nowhere, a piercing SHRIEK An eerie PREDATOR WAR CRY, echoing... as we END SEQUENCE.
Traffic. Choking fumes. Blaring Afro-Cuban JAZZ. THREE CUBAN POLICE OFFICERS push through the locals. Flashing an 8x10 PHOTOGRAPH. Chattering urgently.

An Air Force Lieutenant in dress blues. Handsome. Clean-shaven. MCKENNA. The COPS pass by an ALLEY, routinely peer inside -- Empty. DEAD END. Garbage cans, filth, dried urine. A CAT. No sign of McKenna. They move on. WE HOLD AS...  10. The brindled CAT begins to ripple. To distort.
appear, against the surrounding stucco. A CRACKLE of energy, like TV static, AS -- A MAN materializes before our eyes. Bedraggled, unshaven. Edgy. MCKENNA. HE’S USING THE PREDATOR’S CLOAKING BALL.

AN UNSAVORY PATRON sits at a table, alone. A VOICE: MCKENNA’S VOICE (0O.S.) Dominguez. McKenna “DE-CLOAKS,” again using the Predator device. See to WALK OUT OF THE WALL. DOMINGUEZ, suitably terrified -- McKenna TOSSES A BOX onto the table: THUNK--!

This needs to get across the border. U.S.A. No molestar, comprende? McKenna sweeps side tattered DRAPES to reveal a squat, UGLY building. The U.S. CONSULATE. MCKENNA (SUBTITLED) (CONT’D) Mail out of the consolate has immunity. Get it on the embassy truck. Dominguez eyes the parcel.
I am very scared of the way you appeared to materialize out of the wall. McKenna plunks 12 thousand pesos on the table. In English
Do it. Or I’1ll find you.

McKenna steps outside, affecting nonchalance --  11. The CLATTER of M4s being hefted and aimed at his HEAD. A SUITED MAN steps into view. Intense, calculating eyes. Clearly in charge. For the record? Agent TRAEGER, CIA.
McKenna. You’ve been busy.
Who the fuck are you? Traeger flashes his ID. Gestures to the police.
My friends here’1l escort you to the airfield. Got a DC-8 all gassed up and ready to go.
Wow. Thanks, pal. Where to?
Can’t decide. Either Six Flags, or a remote secure prison.
I don’t like roller coasters.
There it is, then. He FIRES from the hip. A DART embeds itself in McKenna.
A proud sign:
“Home of The Warriors”
as it topples a WHITE PAWN on a chess board.

The room’s hushed. Respectful. Because at lunchtime, thos tabletops with the sinks? They make way for THE CHESS CLU  12. SIX or SEVEN games, in progress. The SCIENCE TEACHER eats lunch at his desk, as... oh, yeah. We should probably men
Eating a sandwich with the crusts cut off as he wanders, scrutinizes every game, like a NASA scientist. This is RORY, 12. He doesn’t know it yet, but he’s going to save the world.
TWO BULLIES stand near a fire alarm, daring each other to pull it. Meet E.J. and DEREK. They will grow up, get bald and attempt to sell you a car.

The alarm PEALS, deafening. EVERYONE’s up like a shot, quickly SHUFFLING OUT of the room. Leaving: RORY, who -- nobody notices -- is curled up in a FETAL BALL; fingers in his ears, eyes squeezed shut, the alarm like fingernails on a chalkboard to him. E.J. AND DEREK appear at the door... Spot Rory, who flinc a deer in headlights. The bullies move in for the kill...

Hey, E.J., you hungry?! E.J. Hell, yeah! You know what I’m hungry for? An ASS BURGER! He KICKS Rory. The nick-name confirms our suspicions: the awkward kid is awkward for a reason: the autism spectrum.

Mm, that sounds delicious! A big, juicy ASS BURGER. Derek gets his kick in. They’re about to unleash more whe -- the alarm STOPS. Sudden, unnerving quiet. Time running out, E.J. and Derek look around for one last indignity. They settle for this: KNOCKING OVER ALL THE CHESS PIECES. Every game ruined. He and Derek trade a LAUGHING high-five, and they’re GONE  13. For a quiet, electric moment, Rory is alone in the room. His eyes flicker across the chess boards: mental inventor Beat. Then -- he SCRAMBLES INTO ACTION. It takes a moment to register what he’s doing. Another to believe it. He puts back every chess piece on every board exactly as were before the fire alarm.. The Chess Club members filter in and return to their game none the wiser. OFF Rory, beaming silently -- CUT TO:
Heading home. Rory LOPES along, talking to himself. Sudde a strident BARKING from behind a picket fence, where:

GROWLS and SNAPS from between the posts. Rory freaks; gives the dog a wide berth, clearly terrified. INT. KITCHEN - RORY’S HOUSE - DAY The sound of a KEY IN A LOCK, then Rory comes through the back door. Replaces the key under the porch mat.

Briefly makes him FIXATE. Seepage. A WATER SPOT. He grabs paper towel, delicately blots away the run-off -- goes to the refrigerator. On which, a hand-written note: SPENT 1.5 HRS CLEANING HOUSE. IF YOU MESS IT UP, I WILL CUT YOU.
A doorbell RINGS off-screen, and --
Rory opens the door, is greeted by a POSTAL WORKER.
Quinn McKenna live here? Rory blinks, not sure what to say. POSTAL WORKER (CONT’D) Didn’t mean to stump you. How’s this: is Quinn McKenna your mom, or your dad?  14.
(nods) Dad.

Now we’re gettin’ somewhere. He upends a handcart -- dumps a big stack of LETTERS AND BOXES onto the porch. POSTAL WORKER (CONT’D) His P.O. box payments are past due. I’m real sorry. He starts away. Hesitates. POSTAL WORKER (CONT’D) Guess he’s not around much, huh? Rory nods. Awkward. The postman frowns: POSTAL WORKER (CONT’D) Lotta D.C. post marks. Government work?

The postman, confused. RORY (CONT’D) Military designation. (beat) He kills people. The postman decides he’s done here. Rory watches him go, as we PAN the huge stack of mail, so that WE SEE: McCKENNA’S PARCEL FROM CUBA.
CASEY BRACKETT, 27, sits on a bench, red penciling papers LEASHES dangle from one arm... a dog BARKS CRAZILY 0O.S.

(to unseen dog) Summer! Stop that! That’s not yours, does it look like it’s yours?  15. A JOGGER with a dog runs by; eyes Casey. Perhaps “ogles” would be more apt. He backtracks. Jogs in place beside her, catching his breath.
How’s it goin’? He huffs, as though having just pushed a boulder uphill. Elaborately towels his neck. A curt DOG-YELP, off-screen
(to unseen dog) Teddy! Knock it off, you can see she doesn’t like that! The jogger, persistent. Extends his hand:
Seen you around here. Doug Amaturo. He conspicuously scritches the ears of his designer DOG - JOGGER (CONT’D) This is Barkolepsy. She has a... sleeping thing. She’s a lab--
-- Labradoodle. Hypoallergenic cross between a poodle and a labrador. Casey STANDS, starts to walk. Persistant Guy, following -
(impressed) Right. That’s right. Are you a breeder?
Science professor. Berkeley.
What do you teach?
Evolutionary biology. The science of how creatures change, adapt.
You mean, like... how a man changes when he meets an attractive woman? Casey grins sourly.  16.
More like -- survival of the fittest.
You believe in that stuff?
You mean science? Yeah. Yes, I do. (beat) It’s funny, Darwin thought it was about strength, agility, intelligence... These days, you just have to be a rich, fat white guy.
I... what?
Drop a CEO into the Serengeti. Only question -- what color animal shits him out. My vote? Reddish-tan. The Jogger: Gulp. He nods slowly.
Um, I don’t wanna hold you up so... He BOLTS. Casey reaches in her jacket, fishes out a silve FLASK -- swigs -- A kindly OLD LADY looks up, says:
I couldn’t help overhearing. Can I ask you something, professor?
Please.
What do your students call you?
“Professor,” mostly.
(smiles sweetly) Maybe they should call you Sunshine. A VOICE interrupts:
Doctor Brackett?  17. Casey turns -- THREE CIA AGENTS stand there. A SEDAN with government plates idles ominously behind them. The lead agent is CHURCH, 30s.

I understand you enjoy star gazing. Casey blinks. WIF? THEN we get it: some kind of CODE. AGENT CHURCH (CONT’D) My men will take care of your dogs. Would you come with me, please? OFF Casey, rattled. CUT TO:
Casey and the CIA man climb into the back. As the driver pulls out, she looks out the back -- at her dogs. AGENT CHURCH (CONT’D) Dog person, huh?
Hey, they don’t judge you, they don’t lie. People have hidden agendas. Animals just love you, or-- tear your throat out. I kinda have to respect that. Church hands her a file folder.
How are you with higher forms of life?
I wasn’t aware there were any. As she opens the file, he shines a pen light to illuminate the TOP SHEET:
The letterhead? A familiar eagle-and-shield insignia: CIA. The page has been stamped TOP SECRET:

SUBJECT: Class 4 Incursion -- Cayo Muerta, Cuba Casey frowns. Glances at the agent. Is this a joke? She speed-reads the next page. A BRIEF on the discovery of the ESCAPE POD in the jungle. Then -- 8X10 PHOTOS:  18. The debris field; the charred escape pod. Next -- McKENNA MILITARY PORTRAIT -- the one Traeger was showing the loca in Cuba. She flips to THE LAST PHOTO; draws a sharp breat
Through trees, vines... a figure. Blurry. Indistinct. It’s a photograph of THE PREDATOR. As we PRE-LAP A CLAP
Lightning dances across the Texas plains as the clouds op SUPER: VETERAN’ S ADMINISTRATION
So, you're denying what you said about some “thing” in the jungle?
MCKENNA sits in a plastic chair at a table, the rain beat on a skylight high above. He’s wearing an orange jumpsuit
I thought this was a psych eval. The V.A. PSYCHOLOGIST stands by, watching a MED TECH attach two pnuemo-tubes around McKenna’s chest.
That’s right.
So why the polygraph? The Med Tech attaches finger pads and a blood pressure cu
It’s common with high risk civil servants. We need to know if you pose a threat.
I’m an assassin. Figured posing a threat was kind of the fucking point. V.A. PSYCH (smiles) I meant to the general public. (MORE)
OR yourself. You’ve been... struggling with PTSD, it’s in your file. McKenna exhales. NOW he gets it.
I get it. You’re not here to find out if I’m crazy -- you're here to make sure the label sticks.
You think you’re being railroaded?
I can see the tracks on the floor. Off the Psych’s sudden raised eyebrow: MCKENNA (CONT’ D) I don’t really see tracks on the floor. Relax. The Psych nods:
But you do see a vast... cover-up. The psychologist switches on the polygraph machine. A laptop GLOWS with a graph of McKenna’s vitals. Game on. V.A. PSYCH (CONT’D) Tell me about Cayo Muerto, Cuba.
People died. I saw something I wasn’t supposed to. Pretty simple. The psychologist looks at the polygraph. Barely a flicker. All graphs straight as arrows.
You’ re gonna have to do better’n that, doc. I was tortured for 48 hours in Kandahar.
You think I’m the enemy, don’t you, Lieutenant?  20.
I think you want me to say something crazy, so you can lock me in a room and throw away the room. That’s what I think.
Maybe some time in a quiet room would do you some good.

You know what would do me some good? Knowing who -- or WHAT -- killed my men. And what that thing in the jungle was. AND why the fuck a Black Ops helicopter conveniently showed up out of nowhere to make sure there weren’t any witnesses. (beat) Knowing all that shit? THAT--? That would do me some good. The Doc looks at the polygraph screen. NOW some flickers. Oh, shit.
Let’s talk about Kandahar. A SPIKE on the graph.
Oooh, BIG spike. You got me now.

You were pinned down. You lost a friend. You got captured, interrogated. Forget the details, but since then--? You spend most of your time in country... estranged from your wife and son because you don’t feel like -- well, you deserve a normal life. You feel like a... stranger on your own planet, don’t you, Lieutenant?

(huge) An alien, you mean? The molecules in the air stop moving. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Like the one in the jungle, right? His eyes gleam. A sick grin. Goading.  21. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Is that good? Is that what you wanted? Do I get a cookie now?
All graphs SPIKING spastically. If he was fighting the appearance of being crazy... he’s failed. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) I think we’re done here.
As do I.
Something like a prison bus idles in front of the administration building, as STAFF escort McKenna into --

McKenna DROPS into a seat. The bus jerks forward, RAIN SPATTERING the windows. While, in the darkness... SEVEN MEN in prison scrubs; eyes that have seen shit that would turn your hair white. McKenna notes a hulking form manacled beside him. Also in 30s, with a comma of dark hair and a scar across one eye. Meet NEBRASKA WILLIAMS. He notices McKenna’s gaze.
Got a smoke?
Pretty sure they don’t allow that on the bus.
(shrugs) Can’t blame a guy for trying. After a pause:
I’m McKenna. You?
Nebraska.  22.
Is that your real name?
Name’s Gaylord.
Good call. McKenna looks out the window thoughtfully. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) How’d you snag a ticket on this shitmobile, anyway?
(impassive) Killed my C.O. This gives McKenna pause. For servicemen, this is not small potatoes.
Any particular reason?
(another shrug) Guy was an asshole. McKenna sits very still. The bus drives on.
Desolate. Windswept. A small cluster of squat buildings guarded by razor wire and ‘NO TRESPASSING’ signs.

And SETS DOWN, dust swirling. TWO SECURITY MERCS jump out, assist CASEY from the open hatch. (NOTE: “Project: Stargazer” is guarded by Private CIA- HIRE MERCENARIES like the ones McKenna saw in Cuba. They are NOT U.S. MILITARY SERVICEMEN. The short version? Stargazer = BAD GUYS; U.S. Military = GOOD GUYS.) A GATE CLATTERS OPEN -- REVEALS a small, square structure. The size of a one-car garage. A MERC goes to the code box as Church hands her a clipboa  23.
Non-disclosure agreement.
I signed that when they recruited me, two years ago.

It’s a rider. New information’s come to light in the last forty- eight hours. Reluctantly, she signs the NDA; is gestured forward. Chur remains behind -- conspicuously. He doesn’t have clearanc The code box emits a hollow CLICK! and BLAST DOORS
Small, compact room. A TECHNICIAN stands at a work statio Scanners; cameras; printers. On the wall: A BIG RED BUTTO
as the TECHNICIAN scans Casey’s RETINAS -- her HAND PRINT -- A BAR CODE prints out -- then Casey is stood against a bare wall, and off a digital camera FLASH--

Now hangs around her neck. She looks up, awkward. Now wha The Technician turns to the big red button; SLAMS IT -- THE WHOLE ROOM SHUDDERS and we hear a WHINE from all around us because... THE ROOM IS AN ELEVATOR. CUT TO:
The elevator door slides OPEN TO REVEAL... A VAST UNDERGROUND COMPLEX. TECHNICIANS bustle to and fro, including (as Casey duly notes) some with lab coats and scrubs. Casey is drawn into a small

Like an operating theater, looking down through raked glass into the MAIN LAB. She sees MED TECHS IN BIOHAZARD SUITS around a custom-bui table with stirrups and monitors. Take a breath now --  24. Because there, strapped to the table, is something she’s waited her whole life to see: an actual, living, extra- terrestrial life form. In this case--? A CAPTURED, UNCONSCIOUS PREDATOR. An involuntary gasp from Casey, as we see in her eyes: her world has changed.
Ma’ am. She SPINS, almost jumps out of her skin. A bespectacled man in the doorway behind her: DOCTOR SEAN COLWELL.

Didn’t mean to startle you. I’m Doctor Colwell. He enters, shakes her hand. COLWELL (CONT’D) I’m told you pretty much wrote the book on evolutionary biology. Casey’s still rattled by the sight of the Predator.
Four, actually. (sheepish) Um... books...
So you know your stuff. How’d they rope you into this..? She looks back into the lab below. Pensive.

I wrote a letter when I was six. Said I loved animals and... if NASA ever found a space animal, they should call me. (beat) Couple years ago, they put me ona short list because of a paper I wrote on hybrid strains. A computer had cross-referenced my letter.
(smiles) NASA still had it, huh? Casey shakes her head.  25.
(CONT’D) The Oval Office. (beat) I wrote the letter to Clinton. He thought it was cute so it’s been in there ever since.
TRAEGER (the CIA man we met in Cuba) squints up through the glass of the viewing booth. Keys an intercom button:
(on intercom) Doctor Brackett..? She nods, tentative. He gestures. TRAEGER (CONT’ D) Would you like to meet the Predator?
White. Sterile. Casey and Colwell enter through an airlock hatch. It SEALS SHUT with a HISS, air-tight.
Chamber secure. Remove garments.
(to VOICE) You’re not gonna buy me a drink first? She and Colwell start to strip, separated by a partition.
CASEY, NAKED in a new chamber -- the room flares WHITE HOT. BURNS OFF her outer layer of skin -- then:

Protocol complete. She dons a HAZMAT SUIT, all business. Dismissive of her nudity. She knows she can halt traffic, doesn’t much care Colwell appears beside her, also in HazMat. Goes to the door. Presses his eye and hand to scanners:  26.
Colwell, Sean H. The LAST HATCH SHUSHES OPEN, and Colwell leads the way in
Traeger approaches her, hand extended:
Thanks for coming. I’m sure - - (an understatement) -- you have questions.
Two, actually. She nods to the dormant Predator. CASEY (CONT’D) Why do you call it “the Predator”?
Just a nick-name. The data suggests it tracks its prey, seems to... well, enjoy it. Like a game.
That’s a hunter.
I’m sorry?

That’s a hunter. Not a predator. Predators kill for food, to survive. There’s only one animal on earth that hunts for sport. Traeger tries not to roll his eyes; “liberal.” Casey paces beside the Predator. Regards its mandibled features with something akin to wonder. Whispers:
(CONT’D) You... are one beautiful motherfucker.

I’m going to assume your second question is: why are you here? An ironic grin from Casey. “Bingo.”  27. TRAEGER (CONT’ D) Our test results yielded something a little... odd. We were wondering if maybe you could shed some light on it. He nods to COLWELL, who produces a TABLET. He shows Casey a read-out. She studies it for a second... then blanches.
Is this a joke?
(shakes his head) We ran the genome sequence ten times. This specimen has --
-- human DNA. She looks at them, baffled. How is that possible?
We know about spontaneous speciation. Mostly plants and insects, but --
-- some mammals. Sheeps, goats. Red wolves are known to be a hybrid of coyotes and gray wolves.
Exactly. Possibly some form of recombinant technology, or...
(interrupting) Guys, I get it. (beat) You want to know if someone fucked a Predator.
Trundling through the night; rain-lashed.
In the strobing dark; rain drums like GUNFIRE at the wind

McKENNA, several years younger, in desert camo, flak, ful battle rattle. He and his squad TAKING COVER, breathless. He glances at the SOLDIER next to him. Pale, trembling. Bleeding out from stray shrapnel. The soldier KEENS with pain, as -- urgent VOICES, close by. Speaking PASHTO. The wounded soldier MOANS loudly. Shit. He’s going to giv away their position. McKenna GRABS him; CLAMPS A HAND ove his mouth as the TALIBAN SOLDIERS get closer -- And as the soldier BITES INTO MCKENNA’S HAND to distract himself from the overwhelming pain --

As McKENNA WAKES. No startle-awake bullshit -- simply com to. Fully aware. His HAND, near his head... THE SCAR we saw in Cayo Muerte: prominent. Now we know ho he got it. From the back of the bus, now, A VOICE:

Hey, Baxley! Got a question for ya. How do you circumcise a homeless man? He’s addressing a prisoner at the front, BAXLEY, whose eyes thin to slits. Clearly, these two have a history. COYLE (CONT’D) Kick your mom in the chin! One of the MPs at the front weighs in:
Shut the fuck up back there! McKenna eyes his measly protein bar. Says to Williams:
Dinner and a show. Great. (indicates stoic BAXLEY) He just sits there.
He’1ll kill him one of these days.
What’s stopping him?  29.

He likes the jokes. McKenna looks to a THIRD prisoner, talking to himself nervously, Tourette’s: FLYBOY. WILLIAMS (CONT’D) That’s Flyboy. Three tours piloting Hueys. Now he gets jumpy when he’s not in the air. McKenna nods to an older Vet -- NETTLES. WILLIAMS (CONT’D) Nettles. Ordnance man. They gave him a medal for blowing up half a mountain in Mosul.
Why’s he here?
Blew up the other half, too. (beat) Everyone’s got a story. What’s yours?
You wouldn’t believe me.
This is the batshit bus. Try me. McKenna shrugs.
All right. (deep breath) I had a run-in with a space alien. They want to put a lid on it, so... here I am. Williams looks out the window, shaking his head. Tsk tsk.
Goddamn space aliens.
CASEY, examining the dormant Predator. Shines a penlight -- checks pupil dilation.

You ran iris biometrics?  30. A nearby MED TECH nods. Casey turns to Traeger. CASEY (CONT’D) Do you have the file they gave me? The incident in Cayo Muerto..? Traeger nods to the med tech. The file is quickly produce and Casey FLIPS to the blurry photo of the Predator. Poin CASEY (CONT’D) In this photo, it’s wearing some kind of... atmosphere mask, a biohelmet.
We looked, believe me. She notices something else:

And look at the wrist computer. Something’s missing. Sure enough, the Predator’s wrist computer is OPEN -- an empty slot where the KUJHAD should be. She looks at Traeg CASEY (CONT’D) Where are they? Traeger and Colwell trade uneasy glances. After a beat, Casey re-opens the file. FLIPS to the photo of... MCKENNA CASEY (CONT’D) Is this the man who made first contact? (Colwell nods) I’d like to talk to him.
He’s en route to lockdown in a military psych ward.
Well, if you’re going to lobotomize him, can I ask him some questions first?
ONE OF THE MPS responds to a SQUAWK from his radio. SPEAK (“Go ahead”). As he listens, his eyes drift to McKenna --
Read you five-by-five. Out.  31.

Gears GRIND. The bus steers to a HALT, sloshing water.. promptly executes a ponderous and awkward U-TURN. THROUGH GLASS: we push in on McKENNA, confused... CUT TO: EXT. RORY’S HOUSE (GEORGIA) - NIGHT Neighborhood SOUNDS: THRUM of cicadas, bad TV, distant sirens. A dinged Subaru Outback pulls into the driveway. INT. RORY’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER Rory’s mom, EMILY -- pretty, 30s, beleaguered -- comes through the back door into the kitchen, arms weighted dow by shopping bags. She CALLS OUT:

Rory? I’m home! I got you something! Rory -- ? RORY APPEARS -- Mom gives him a quick kiss. She sees a st of LANGUAGE BOOKS on the counter: French, German, Swedish EMILY (CONT’D) You did one of these after school?
I did all of them after school. She smiles, fumbles with a bag from Target.

So look. I got you two options... She pulls out TWO BOXED HALLOWEEN COSTUMES -- Like those Ben Cooper specials from yesteryear. In this case..? EMILY (CONT’D) Pirate..? Or Frankenstein..? She holds up each with equal gusto; he regards her blankl
What’s Frankenstein?
You know -- Frankenstein. Mad doctor made him out of dead people? Bolts on his neck? Walks around?
Like “Walking Dead”?  32.

No, Frankenst... Green skin? He met Wolfman? Rory looks at her like she grew a tail. Exasperated, she holds up the OTHER BOX as if her son just won a prize. EMILY (CONT’D) Let’s go with PIRATE -- !! But he’s not really buying any of it. He takes the mask out of the box, reluctantly puts it on. RORY’S POV: The sound of his BREATHING as, through the eye holes, WE SEE: THAT WATER SPOT -- the one on the kitchen WALL, as
Rory, a mere BABE in his mother’s arms as McKENNA drives FIST through the SPOT, for reasons long forgotten, and --
It’s been plastered over; yet the ghost of McKenna’s rage continues to ooze out... Rory puts the pirate mask down:
It’s too small. The guys’ll... you know. (shrugs) They’1l still be able to tell. RORY’S MOM Tell what?
That it’s me. (sets the box down) No big deal. Dad’s always telling me to be a big boy. He starts out of the room.
I love you, peanut.
(half-hearted; in Swedish) Jag alskar dig. His mom looks after him, blinking back tears.  33.

Rory comes down the steps to his LAIR: recycled PCs, saved from dumpsters. Multiple ON-LINE GAMES glow. A hanging sign reads: “CONTROL AREA.” Rory sits, fingers blurring as he speed runs through two games simultaneously. But gradually... his distraction wi He turns to look at his work table, ON WHICH RESIDES: THE PARCEL FROM CUBA. He sucks in a sharp breath. Goes to it... and TEARS IT OP like a Christmas present. Reaches in, and removes... Holy shit -- THE BATTLE-SCARRED PREDATOR BIOHELMET. The iconic WAR MASK from five separate films. It DWARFS this suburban boy’s delicate hands. He examines it. Sets it aside, reaches for the next prize THE KUJHAD; the data-storage device. It GLISTENS in his grasp. He hefts it like a light-sabre. Then -- Curiously, hesitantly, presses a button on the device. Nothing. Emboldened, he presses another. And another. And anoth -- BLEEP--! Oooh, shit. A DISPLAY BLINKS ON; GLOWING RED symbols scrolling in cryptic patterns. Rory’s eyes widen as we -- CUT TO:
Cold. Silent. OUR OPENING SHOT all over again, as... A LOOMING SPACECRAFT enters frame. Bulbous. Cockroach- shaped. We’ve seen it before:
from our opening; docking gantry below still scarred and shredded from where THE ARK detached.

Quick, tantalizing glimpses of this new, different PREDAT We still don’t see him fully. Not yet. As we will come to learn: this is AN UPGRADE.  34. It taps a control pad -- and a DISPLAY APPEARS, similar to Rory’s. Speaking of whom:

SCRIBBLES the symbols from the Kujhad on a PeeChee folder. Glances up -- The symbols CHANGE. Blip-! Just like that, a new sequence. Rory scrunches up his face. Huh. Have you ever seen someone “do math” by using their finge to create invisible equations in the air? Well, that’s wh Rory does now, except... THE SYMBOLS HE WROTE LIFT off the paper, SUPERIMPOSED for us to see. He does some mental calculations, and -- The symbols RE-ARRANGE. (NOTE: This is NOT REAL. It depicts Rory’s mental process We are literally watching him translate Predator language
He TAPS BUTTONS, causing the display to CHANGE BACK, and
THE UPGRADE REACTS as his READ-OUT CHANGES, too. A glitch taps the controls, REVERTING it to its previous version -
sees the DISPLAY CHANGE again -- and OVERRIDES IT exactly as he did before. “Take that!” And we realize -- Our kid is REMOTELY FUTZING AN INCOMING PREDATOR SPACECRA
The Upgrade, all business. SLAMS IN A CODE, and
With shimmering spasms, its STEALTH CAPABILITY is engaged and the ship literally VANISHES--!
Grinning at the new code sequence. It’s a GAME! Gleefully he punches in the same sequence, only IN REVERSE, and --
The transparent Predator Mother Ship BECOMES VISIBLE AGAI  35.
A VOICE from upstairs breaks the moment:
You okay down there, kiddo? Rory freezes, tries to sound like everything’s normal.
Just playing games, mom!
Love you!
Oui, J'aime ma mére!
as a BLIP APPEARS. Then vanishes. Then RE-APPEARS.
A TECH SERGEANT in army khaki watches the blip on his sco
The analyst FLAGS his SUPERVISOR.
Sir? His uniformed SUPERVISOR walks over.
Whatcha got, sergeant?
Weird-ass bogey, sir. What do you make of it? They watch as the blip VANISHES and RE-APPEARS sporadical OTHER TECHS look on curiously. The supervisor frowns.
Get me NORAD.

CASEY, bent over an electron microscope. Intent. Examinin the Predator’s blood. Traeger, over her shoulder --  36. She rises from the microscope, sees a blood centrifuge nearby, a test tube rack just above it. In the rack is: A SINGLE VIAL of membranous yellow substance. She frowns:
Wait a minute. (re: centrifuge) If this is blood -- (re: vial) -- then what’s that? Traeger looks vaguely discomfited. But before he can answer, a LACKEY approaches.
V.A. shuttle’s here, sir.
Black-clad MERCENARIES wait for the V.A. SHUTTLE as it trundles toward the chain link perimeter.
Prisoners, GRUMBLING. Flyboy calls out to the MP at the front (who, we should note, is bald as a cue ball).
Hey, Kojak! When did they put the middle of fucking nowhere on the itinerary?
Zip it, Flyboy. We’re just makin’ a pit stop.
“Pit stop.” (to McKenna) This is all your fault, isn’t it? McKenna, uneasy. It’s beginning to seem that way. CUT TO:

location: NORTH AMERICAN AEROSPACE DEFENSE COMMAND, COLORADO

text: Fans of War Games will recognize the gallery and massive TRACKING SCREENS. Air Force PERSONNEL watch the bogey on
where THE BLIP is seen moving toward the southern U.S... A GENERAL oversees; STAFF SERGEANT at his side.  37.
Still inbound, sir. One second they’re on the grid, the next they’re ghosting.
Radio contact?
Negative, sir. The General chews on a pen. What the fuck is it? Finally:
Where’s the 325th?
Lackland, sir.
Have them scramble some jets. Let’s not take any chances.
Traeger’s AIDE approaches. Furtive:
Sir, NORAD’s reporting a 202 anomaly. Colwell and Traeger trade looks. Casey sees this.
Look, I know I’m new, but -- it’d be swell if somebody would kinda sorta, I dunno... tell me what the fuck is going on here? Traeger answers without missing a beat.
This isn’t the first Predator we’ve encountered. Casey stiffens. The revelation lands hard. TRAEGER (CONT’ D) Apparently they use earth as a kind of “hunting ground.”  38.
They’ ve left things behind. Evidence. Weapons. Some are even stored in this facility.
Your point -- ?
The point, doctor... is that our satellite defense stations have just tracked a new UFOB. (nods grimly to the dormant Predator) Our friend here might have company coming.
Traeger MUTTERS something under his breath --
Excuse me?
They’ re gnarly fuckers, that’s all. Took four of my best just to bring that one down. She blinks. Stares at him:
I’m sorry. It took four--?
That’s right. So?
So -- a meth head can take down four men. (re: Predator) Look at it! Traeger looks uneasy.
What’s your point, doctor?
My point is you brought it here. To a location where you just happen to store its weapons -- (beat) How do you know it didn’t WANT
That’s when ALARM KLAXONS peal throughout the complex. CASEY (CONT’D) What’s happening? TRAEGER’S AIDE clutches a phone receiver. YELLS:

Proximity alert, sir! Bogey’s inbound! Range two hundred miles! At which point, without warning -- THE PREDATOR’S EYES SNAP OPEN. Just like that. Alert. Calm. Calculating. We realize: it was playing poss CASEY LEAPS backward; liberates a TRANQUILIZER RIFLE from nearby rack. She hoists it, BACKS AWAY -- full defense mo

She STABS the code for the DECON chamber. Hatch OPENS. Sh leaps inside, except -- she’s the only one. Everyone else is going for their SIDEARMS as -- Bam--! The Predator MOVES. SNAPS ITS RESTRAINTS like they were paper. RISES from the table, as --
The hatch CLOSES, sealing her in.
Chamber secure. Remove garments. Casey, sweating. FUMBLING at the catches of her Hazmat su
Come on, come on...
SECURITY MEN rush to restrain the Predator, but it SWIPES at them with its talons -- DUCKS, PARRIES. TOSSES them like rag dolls. Speed and stealth, mind-numbi
SEEING THIS -- terrified -- while at the same time desperately trying to DISROBE. Blood SPATTERS the window  40.

THE PREDATOR, rampaging. COLWELL draws a weapon -- but it GRABS HIM by the hair; snags a scalpel in its other talon. Like a samurai -- BEHEADS HIM with the scalpel--! The next second, SLICES O HIS HAND -- Then BEE-LINES TO THE DECON HATCH... Spoils in hand, PRESSES COLWELL’S HEAD and HAND to the scanners. Then, nightmarishly: MIMICS the dead man’s voice exactly:
Colwell, Sean H. A green light BLEEPS. ACCESS GRANTED--!

Skin burn complete, Casey’s scooping up her clothes, as -- the HATCH SHUSHES OPEN behind her. She SPINS, naked - - clutching the trang gun. -- And there’s THE PREDATOR. Trembling, breathless, Casey LEVELS THE WEAPON. Pulls the trigger: a dry CLICK--! Jammed. The Predator cocks its head at her. Is it... smiling? And then -- it simply MOVES PAST her. SPARING HER. As Casey breathes in short terrified bursts, we --
THREE F-22 RAPTORS slice the sound barrier -- following the Predator ship’s last known position.
ON THE LEAD PILOT as he checks his instruments. We HEAR:
Catfish one, approaching vector. Triangulate SAM radar, over.

THREE TACTICAL MERCS spin round a bend, rifles up. As the clatter past an alcove, two MUSCULAR ARMS SWIPE OUT--!  41. GLTCH--GLTCH! TALONS puncturing flesh; severing brain stems. Two down. The remaining merc SPINS, gun up -- Predator, weaponless... Fuck it -- SCOOPS A MACHINE GUN IN EACH HAND. BUDDA-BUDDA--! The merc topples. The Predator calmly DROP the guns, retrieves Colwell’s head and hand from the floo

Casey finishes pulling on her clothes, notices -- on the floor, splatters of phosphorescent GREEN BLOOD. She looks back into the lab -- at the tranq gun CARTRIDGE on the rack. Then... something arguably more important: The mysterious SPECIMEN VIAL she saw earlier.
The Predator approaches a VAULT DOOR; again uses Colwell’ VISCERA to override security. TOSSES THEM ASIDE and ENTER

Like a bank vault, but for Predator technology. The Predator RUMMAGES; tossing items aside violently. Plainly looking for something... but not finding it. Frustrated, it GRABS what it knows -- a new WRIST GAUNTLE a PLASMA CANNON. Finally, snatches up a THIRD object: A bent, scorched BATTLE MASK. With this last, it does an odd thing: lifts the mask to its eyes. With one hand, taps a code on its side, blip-!

We’re seeing what IT is seeing. Here’s the weird part: Wherever it is..? It’s not the room he’s currently IN. Blurry... faulty transmission. Still, oddly FAMILIAR. We’re seeing Rory’s bedroom. WTF? CUT TO: INT. RORY’S BASEMENT - SAME TIME THE OTHER MASK, Rory’s -- leaning against the wall, face outward. A green LIGHT blinking, as it transmits --

We see RORY at his bench, back to us... now we SNAP-ZOOM in to a spot on the wall, near the kid’s head: A drawing of a pit bull. Taped there, along with other drawings. In the corner, printed neatly: RORY DECLAN McKENNA, GRADE 6. GORDON MIDDLE SCHOOL The Predator lowers the mask. Turns, with new purpose. Ta wrist and... with a glitching SHIMMER, CLOAKS. Vanishing.
The V.A. bus STOPS, MID-COMPOUND. ALARMS continue to WAIL throughout the facility. SOLDIERS approach --
Sit tight. There’s been a breech.
MCKENNA AND WILLIAMS, apprehensive. What’s going on?

Dressed and clutching the tranq rifle, Casey follows a tr of Predator blood to THE STILL-OPEN VAULT -- immediately it’s been ransacked. What the hell was it looking for? A bleeding MED-TECH stumbles around the corner, sees her:
Please... It... it MUSTN’T GET AWAY...
It won't. (nods grimly) Not my space animal. She turns -- sprints out of frame, and meanwhile
Flying in formation. PILOTS scanning the horizon.

Catfish one, still no visual, check your six two and three, over -- INT. RORY’S HOUSE - BASEMENT - SAME He’s back to his video games. Because of course he is.  43. Then... bored, he picks up the Kujhad. PUNCHES IN THE CODE from before... just for the hell of it, and --
THE PREDATOR SHIP APPEARS OUT OF NOWHERE -- smack in the trajectory of the three Raptor jets!
(filtered) (filtered) Holy shit! Heads up! Bandit! Three-zero- five!
Milliseconds before impact --

Something outside the bus catches McKenna’s eye: A DARK FIGURE -- emerging from a bunker in the distance. hulking, lithe, humanoid chameleon shape. Shimmering.... McKenna nudges Williams, who squints... the thing FLICKER seems to VANISH in mid-stride. Williams stiffens --
Your little green friend?
Yup.
Turns invisible?
Yup.
Goddamn space aliens.
CASEY emerges, into the night. Trang gun at the ready. Co around the edge of a building, SEES a Predator BLOOD TRAI
ALARM KLAXONS wailing outside. McKenna, fraught. Struggling to concoct an escape strategy. Williams sees the look; doesn’t like it.
(re: Predator) That thing killed my men.
Yeah, they’1l do that. Stay on the bus.
What are you, nuts? We gotta move.
Exactly. Stay on the bus. McKenna, thrown. Williams looks at him, sidelong: WILLIAMS (CONT’D) It’s a bus. He swivels his head -- a barely perceptible NOD to COYLE.
(erupts) Hey, Baxley! If your mom’s vagina was a video game, it’d be rated E for everyone! The SECOND MP rattles the cage door with his baton.
Knock it off!

Seriously, what’s the difference between five big black guys and a joke? (beat) Baxley’s mom can’t take a joke! Baxley’s out of his seat so fast he’s a blur -- manacles clutched in his fists, he WRAPS THEM AROUND COYLE’S NECK -- choking him--! Coyle GASPS, SPUTTERS. The second MP fumbles with his key ring as the first UNCL HIS SIDEARM, adrenaline spiking. Yells to the prisoners:

Everyone on the floor, face down! THE OTHERS OBEY; kneel with heads bowed, as -- The second MP UNLOCKS THE CAGE DOOR -- GRABS a Remington pump action from its mount. Both men RUN up the aisle to:  45.

As they pry the two prisoners apart, the first MP reaches for the baton on his belt, except: shit. It’s not there. BECAUSE BAXLEY JUST NABBED IT--! SWINGS IT into the back of the MP’s legs. HE GOES DOWN hard, as -- SECOND MP whips the SHOTGUN UP. Barely time to register: COYLE, right in front of him, SHOVES the barrel with his palm so it CLOCKS THE MP in the forehead -- CRACK! -- dropping him. Coyle GRABS the shotgun -- And TOSSES IT TO WILLIAMS, who SPINS, cocks it -- K-CHUK! - and levels it at the DRIVER.

Whoopsie. THE DRIVER puts his HANDS UP as Baxley and Coyle -- the b of friends now -- snag the guards’ keys and start unlocki the prisoners’ shackles. A ruse from square one. Shorn of his manacles, Williams takes the DRIVER’S SEAT.
I need that alien.
Don’t think he’1l board the bus willingly.
Just get me close. WILLIAMS jerks the bus into gear... and GUNS IT.

As it CLOAKS and DE-CLOAKS itself. One second, it’s there. The next: GONE. Vanished. IT LEAPS, parkour style. Alights on a rooftop, and -- Suddenly pauses, EARS PRICKED. It darts a look SKYWARD as, without warning --
Blasts across the sky. Holy shit. Shearing through the atmosphere, and, with even LESS warning --
Jesus. Flashing through frame, fucking DEAFENING, as
It PUNCHES through a fence--! Chain link whipping away --

WILLIAMS is DRIVING like a mad man, eyes darting between the SPACESHIP and the buildings below. McKENNA yells: MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Open the door!! He YANKS the Remington from Williams. Door, HISSING open
On the open steps, sighting up the barrel of the weapon. Cold intent. Everything goes SILENT.
And there it is: through his sight, the trademark Predator DISTORTION. Nearing the tree line, CUT TO:
Tops a ladder, swings onto rusty metal BRIDGE. High groun Surveys the compound... bingo. BLOOD TRAIL, 12 o’clock. A sudden RUMBLE, she looks down, SEES:
THUNDERING UNDER the bridge. She times her jump -- DROPS DOWN, ONTO THE ROOF -- thunk! Swivels the TRANQ GUN, targeting the TREE LINE, just as
MCKENNA LEAPS FREE, shotgun tight to his chest. He TUCKS ROLLS. Comes up, GETS OFF TWO SHOTS -- too little, too la
Over the perimeter wall. As an afterthought, the creature lashes out: SEVERS a LIGHT POLE -- it CRUMPLES DOWNWARD -
WILLIAMS SEES the obstacle. Shit! STANDS ON THE BRAKES --  47.
COLLIDES with the massive pole, tires BLOWN, as

Loses her footing; TOPPLES backward. Still clutching the trang gun, she squeezes the trigger involuntarily, and -- THPPP--! A DART imbeds itself in her foot. She ROLLS OFF the top of the bus like a string-cut marionette, as --

McKenna sees her pitch off the side, SCRAMBLES TO catch h Then quickly registers the ARMED SECURITY MEN moving in from all sides, and hastily (comically) FLEES just as -- WHOMP--! Casey LANDS on the ground with an ugly KLUD! She ROLLS OVER; groggy. So much for Prince fucking Charming.
The others SCRAMBLE OUT, as NEBRASKA WILLIAMS spots: A small, open Quonset hut with a column of vintage, army green HARLEY MOTORCYCLES. He yells:
Get to the choppers.
One of the MERCS sees Casey, on the ground: he taps a switch on his VIDEO HEADSET -- CUT TO:
TRAEGER has his own glass-like headset with THE MERC’S PO
(awaiting the order) Sir..? Traeger sighs, deep regret:
No witnesses.

The MERC, about to follow orders when a BURBLING ROAR fills the air, and --  48. McKENNA COMES OVER THE TOP AIRBORNE on his howling HARLEY. Launches off an embankmen FIRES MID-AIR, blam-blam-! takes out the dude’s LEGS. Lands. Fishtails madly -- steers toward Casey; pure Steve McQueen. SCOOPS HER UP -- And here come THE LOONIES; Williams in the lead! A phalan of crazy-ass Hell’s Angels. The recovering mercs OPEN FIRE -- as the cycles BLAST FORWARD, out of the compound, as we CUT TO:
THE F-22S FLY alongside and above the NOW-VISIBLE PREDATOR SPACECRAFT, rocking their wings.
Go, zero-two! Go zero-three! AIR-TO-AIR MISSILES spew from the Raptors, and RIP ACROSS surface of the Predator ship. It bucks and WOBBLES, as --

THE F-22s BANK OFF as the PREDATOR SHIP TUMBLES, smoking. A glitching SHIMMER as it manages to CLOAK itself one final time... seconds before it impacts -- And now, an odd sight -- one we hinted at in our opening: An INVISIBLE CRASH. The leafy canopy EXPLODES, then a careening DEBRIS FIELD forming before our eyes -- All that’s missing is the ship that’s CAUSING IT.
Tendrils of vapor rise, and...

Amidst choking smoke, the UPGRADE rises from its seat. Touches a switch, and A PANEL OPENS, revealing a dank, cramped COMPARTMENT. Inside, barely glimpsed -- The eerie silhouettes of TWO slobbering, four- legged CREATURES... Whoa. CUT TO:

INT. RORY’S ROOM - NIGHT Rory lies in bed. Wide awake. Peering into a tiny KEYCHAIN VIEWER with a light in it: A PHOTO -- Father and son in happier times. RORY sighs. Rolls over. Turns on his bedside table lamp -- And there, on the nightstand, is THE KUJHAD. The BIOHELMET sits beside it; eerie, beckoning. Rory reaches for the Kujhad, but it’s no longer blinking. Shit. He THUMBS buttons to wake it up. Nothing at first. Then.. GLOWS RED. Success! Rory chews his lip, thinking. What ne And then he learns the meaning of the phrase, “Be careful what you wish for.” Because suddenly: SHAPES, moving in his peripheral vision. He looks up. GAS

Crawling on the walls and ceiling. Out of nowhere. All around him/ Terrified, Rory starts to hyperventilate. He STABS BUTTONS in a desperate bid to make them go away Then notices: the spiders are GLITCHING with electronic distortion. He double-takes, SEES -- MONOFILAMENTS OF LIGHT emanating from the biohelmet... it’s the source of the images. Not just images: HOLOGRAPHIC PROJECTIONS. He picks up the helmet, lifts it to his face and...

Like police video, the spiders are PRE-RECORDED IMAGES OF A PREDATOR HUNT ON ANOTHER WORLD. At his fingertips is A VIRTUAL DOCUMENT of the Predators’ travels across the galaxy. He pulls the mask away, a stew of various IMAGES projecte IN 3D all around him. Including something he didn’t expec What appears to be A MAP.  50. At its center, a highlighted, ALIEN SHAPE. Blinking. A beacon, a marker? Or maybe, just maybe...? A transponder.
NEBRASKA WILLIAMS smokes a cigarette in the blinking neon of the motel sign. He hears A SCUFFLE, turns to SEE: NETTLES, emerging from behind the sign. Zipping his pants
Nettles. (nods to motel room) There’s a toilet in the room. Nettles eyes widen, like he’s just seen God.

A staccato KNOCK on the door (a code). FLYBOY opens it, lets Williams and Nettles back in. CASEY’s in the bed, sleeping off the tranquilizer dart -- THE REST OF THE VETS gathered around. McKenna, weary, Say
Don’t any of you guys have someplace to be? The Loonies trade glances. Shrug.
V.A. Psych Ward?
Military prison? McKenna nods.
Point taken.
So now what, chief? Your green boy got away.
I’m tellin’ you -- TV news, bro. They’1l have to believe you.  51.
Right. And I have some land in Florida to sell you.
Just get somebody credible. Like Channel 9. What’s-her-name, the lady with the big heinie --
Fool, she’s the meteorologist.
She is?
(chiming in) He’s right -- one look at her and you can tell whether. The others trade looks -- what does that even mean? Then:
If we can get someone to listen --
And if ‘if’s and buts’ were candy and nuts, we’d all have a merry Christmas. Baxley subsides, grumpily. On the BED, CASEY stirs -- blinks awake. Alarmed to see THE LOONIES surrounding her.

I love waking to the sound of macho bullshit. She grimaces. Fumbles out her CELL PHONE -- Incredibly, McKenna GRABS the shotgun, COCKS IT: Is he gonna shoot he No. He GRABS THE PHONE, shoves it under a pillow, and -- muted BOOM--! The pillow’s a smoking ruin. PHONE, vanquis CASEY (CONT’D) (stunned disbelief) Are you crazy--? A beat. Then a SMALL CHORUS:
Maybe. A little. I dunno, probably. (etc.) McKenna ignores them. Turns to Casey.  52.
Use your head, lady. You want them tracing that phone?
(chiming in) Question. Everyone looks at him --
(CONT’D) (to McKenna) How much you askin’ for this land in Florida? Casey huffs impatiently. She starts up, heads for the doo
You guys can play house if you want, I have dogs to feed and midterms to grade --

Don’t be stupid. She looks up sharply. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) They tried to put a bullet in your head back there. (eyes smouldering) You’re expendable. Just like the rest of us. That STOPS her. She exhales. Looks round at the “unit” --

Expendables, huh? More like the Seven fucking Dwarfs. Nettles grins bashfully -- Casey sighs. CASEY (CONT’D) Can I borrow a phone, at least? I need someone to feed my dogs. She flops in a chair. Gazes up at McKenna. CASEY (CONT’D) You saw it first, didn’t you? The Predator? (off his quizzical look) I read the file. Those men it killed -- yours?  53. McKenna nods, grim. McKenna’s CASEY (CONT’D) I figured. You may as well have written their script. Psycho ex- sniper. PTSD, divorced... even got a flaky kid who curls up ina ball, it’s perfect -- eyes blaze. She shrugs: CASEY (CONT’D) I’m just telling you what’s in the file.
It said “flaky?”
That was an unfortunate embellishment. Can we move on?
(joining in) We can start with what you were doing at a supposedly abandoned military base -- full of private soldiers. Mercs.
I’m an evolutionary biologist. I was on call in case of... you know, contact. McKenna thinks it over, paces. Stops, exhales raggedly...

If we wanna keep breathin’, we gotta find this thing. Expose it. We all agreed? A look goes round. A bonding moment... exiles, all; perfect scapegoats. No none will miss them. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Good. First things first. What is it?

The Predator? Well... (shrugs) It has human DNA, for one thing. The loonies react. WHAT?  54. CASEY (CONT’D) That’s not all. I was there when it escaped, it... I think it was looking for something. McKenna goes pale with realization.
Its equipment. He looks up -- realizes all eyes are on him. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) I took it. So I’d have evidence. (swallows hard) I... I think I know where it’s headed. Pause. Nettles clears his throat:
We’re gonna need some ordnance.
“Ordnance”?
You know. Weapons and shit. Nebraska Williams’ brow furrows. Plotting.
I know a guy.
A parked, two-tone WINNEBAGO SUPER CHIEF. From inside:
the 41 year-old came to this Texas home to meet our decoy, whom he believes to be an underage girl.
Every square inch CRAMMED with war mementos and weaponry. Been to a gun show? That. A grizzled man in a WHEELCHAIR watches TV. Master Gunnery Sergeant GARRISON CUTTER, 60s.
And what are you up to today?  55.
Nothin’. Just came to hang out.

I see you brought some condoms and some Mike’s Hard Lemonade. There’s a RAP on the door, and Cutter ROLLS himself the entire three feet to answer it as he RAISES AN M16. He opens up enough to see a sliver of a face:
Gunny.
Well, if it ain’t Nebraska Williams.

Just wonderin’ how’d you feel about a little recon mission... Cutter peers through the crack in the door, SEEING: THE GROUP OF LOONIES in the moonlight. McKenna. The other The very uncomfortable, but equally appealing... CASEY. Behind him: dirty laundry. Take-out containers. A cat YOW
Let me check my schedule.

INT. BASEMENT (RORY’S HOUSE) - EVENING Rory, in his “Control Area” wearing the Frankenstein mask his mom bought him. He pulls it off, frowning. Lame. Then -- a scuffling SOUND at the basement window. He turn SEE what appears to be...
SNIFFING at the window. The neighbor’s pit bull...? It disappears -- he doesn’t pay it much mind.
EMILY does the dishes -- oblivious as RORY, clutching something, furtively heads out the back door BEHIND HER. PRE-LAP: the SOUND OF A DOORBELL RINGING, and --  56.
Emily opens the door to reveal: TRAEGER, flanked by armed SECURITY MEN.
Mrs. McKenna? (flashes his ID) Can we have a word?
REVEAL MCKENNA and the rest of the vets, HIDDEN IN THE BU with field glasses and talkies. Williams aims A SHOTGUN M at the house, allows them to hear the conversation:
Let me guess: he’s done something crazy.
Why would you guess that..?
Because the look on your face says he’s not dead, and yet here you fucking are. STEVENS notices a locked GUN CASE in the adjoining study.
Those are his. He’s a hunter. (sighs) Look, I haven’t seen Quinn for a year. He’s on assignment.
How about your son -- where is he?
Around here somewhere. Why?
Mind if we speak with him?

Traeger and the security men come down the stairs, finding Rory’s lair... but the kid? Nowhere to be seen. RORY’S MOM That’s weird. If he’s not in his room, he’s always here. He said he was going trick-or-treating, but...  57. She frowns. SEES the two discarded costumes on his work table. Why would he leave without his costume?

RORY timidly roams the neighborhood, surrounded by costumed trick-or-treaters and their parents. His head, ENCASED IN THE PREDATOR’S BIOHELMET. The KUJHAD, clutched by his side. Swell costume. Navigating’s a bit tricky, he stumbles a little -- RORY’S POV: Human HEAT SIGNATURES. Every direction. INT. WINNEBAGO (NEAR RORY’S HOUSE) - NIGHT CUTTER at the wheel, taking watch. At the NOOK in back, C squints into a microscope. Murmurs, under her breath --
It’s like a supermatrix of tryhydroxy and amino acids... She pulls back from the lens. Blinks, incredulous: CASEY (CONT’D) With evidence of recombinant gene splicing.
What’s that mean?

If I’m right..? It means they’re trying to upgrade themselves. She picks up a TALKIE, keys it: CASEY (CONT’D) McKenna? I’ve found something. EXT. OUTSIDE RORY’S HOUSE - NIGHT McKenna’s TALKIE SQUELCHES -- he quickly turns it down. Then he freezes -- notices something in the shadows: THAT “DOG” FROM EARLIER. Sniffing at the basement windows INT. RORY’S HOUSE - SAME Inside, Traeger ALSO hears it. Stops, looks toward the ba of the house. Nods to TWO OF HIS MEN to check it out --  58.
TRAEGER’S MEN EMERGE from the house and fan out.

head_text.subj: WITH ONE OF THE SECURITY MEN

text: Flashlight up. He catches a glimpse of “the dog” as it pads away into the brush. Keys his talkie:
I’m on it. Triangulate on my signal.
The Security Man SLAPS a bug from his cheek. Then, a GRUNTING SOUND from nearby. He WHIPS HIS FLASHLIGHT ONTO
Foraging in a pile of garbage. It looks up, beady-eyed --

(CONT’D) You scared the shit out of me, you little walking helmet. Which is when -- the armadillo SCREAMS (yes, they do that It’s looking past the Security Man, who HEARS a throaty CLICKING SOUND behind him, and SPINS, face-to-face with:
ONE OF THE FOUR-LEGGED CREATURES from the ship! Yellow, albino eyes. MANDIBLES. The man turns to RUN -- BUT HE’S BLOCKED by the SECOND CREATURE!

Strangled screams. IMPOTENT GUNSHOTS shatter the suburban stillness as -- EXT. RORY’S HOUSE - THAT MOMENT TRAEGER bursts from the back door with his remaining Secu Man. They RUSH in the direction of the screams and gunsho
He stumbles to a mute halt, SEEING: THE FIRST OF HIS MEN, splayed inside-out. The other one, nearby. Similarly crimson.  59. Traeger registers alarm, but oddly, not much surprise. He keys his talkie:
Team Edward to Team Jacob. Secure the perimeter.
MCKENNA AND THE MEN, guns up. CASEY joins them, GRABS a pair of night-vision binocs to SEE:
Retreating into the night. She swallows; adrenaline pumpi
Jesus... (catches her breath) They’re dogs. McKenna looks at her like she has antlers.
Excuse me?

The Predators -- they’re hunters, get it? A mordant grin, despite herself: CASEY (CONT’D) They brought their fucking dogs. INT. RORY’S HOUSE - NIGHT McKenna SLAMS THROUGH THE FRONT DOOR, finds himself face to face with Emily -- HIS WIFE. Stone-faced:
Hi, honey, you’re home. An awkward moment -- then she clocks the shotgun in his h
Where’s Rory?
Oh, I get it. You think you can just waltz in here and --
I asked you a question.  60.
(calling upstairs Agent Traeger, he’s down here!!
Nice try. (taps earbud) I was listening. Oh, and “What’s he done now?” Thanks for that.
What was I supposed to say?
How about, “My ex-husband -- is my he all right?” This catches her off-guard.
I thought you... hit bottom.
Not yet. But hey, the night’s young. (repeats) Where’s our son?
McKenna bee-lines to Rory’s “Control Area,” SEES THE PARCEL he sent from Cuba. He shakes it. EMPTY. MCKENNA (CONT’D) Shit -- !
(on the stairs) What? He ordered some video games.

No no no no... McKenna rifles through Rory’s stuffs for any trace of the alien tech. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) The whole fucking reason I sent it to a P.O. box was so I wouldn’t put you in danger! Goddammit. (turns to her) We need to find him -- NOW. He BOLTS, heading upstairs again --  61.
Quinn, you’re scaring me.
Back the way they came. McKenna tosses over his shoulder:
So you let him order any video games he wants?
Excuse me?
I specifically said -- no first person shooters, no combat games. You don’t even check, do you?
Whatever. He has, like, THREE. Jesus-- He turns on her.

Yes. And did you ever think that maybe he plays them to connect with his father?? (catches herself Oh my God, we’re doing this. She STOPS. Sees: THE LOONIES, gathered in her living room. A comical momen as they grin stupidly. Sheepish waves. McKenna, meanwhile: snatching PHOTOS OF RORY from walls, tables. School portraits, holiday pics -- EMILY (CONT’D) What are you doing? Give me those! (to McKenna, re: Loonies) Who are these people?! He calmly takes the pictures from her.
They’re my unit. They’re soldiers. She blinks, incredulous:  62.
They look like ushers at a porno theater. (to Williams) No offense.
(to McKenna) The wife..?
For better or worse. (waves a hand) Emily? Loonies. Loonies? Emily.
Wait, back up -- your unit? (frowns) What happened to Haines..? Dupree?

They’re dead. (deep breath) And the thing that killed them is looking for Rory. SO. You can think I’m crazy all you want -- He looks her dead in the eye: MCKENNA (CONT’ D) But right now? Our son is ina kill box. He turns to the Loonies: MCKENNA (CONT’ D) I want a grid search. Three teams. He gives the first picture to Williams.

(CONT’D) You go west. (another picture for Baxley and Coyle) You two, east. (one for Nettles and Flyboy) Up the middle. He turns to Emily -- who’s shrugging into her COAT. Snatc up, of all things, a FIREPLACE POKER. He GRABS IT away --  63.
What are you doing? Our son’s in danger!
That’s right, and last time I looked -- ? (hefts his GUN) This is match grade. (the POKER) This, not so much. But points for originality.

He turns to the Loonies: MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Objective area’s eight square blocks. Parallel sweeps. Stay on your radios. (beat) Find my son. EXT. OUTSIDE RORY’S HOUSE - NIGHT WILLIAMS AND THE LOONIES split up with military precision years of training back in play. McKenna turns to his wife MCKENNA (CONT’ D) They’ re gonna come back, and they’re gonna ask questions. All that matters is our boy. (hands her a phone) This is a burner, I’11l call you.
I don’t like what you do, Quinn. I never did. (grudging) But watching you do it--?
Turns you on, doesn’t it? A warm look between them; a history of good and bad and everything in-between.
Get out of here before I open that gun case.
RORY lifts the Predator helmet, watches OTHER KIDS ringin doorbells, collecting goodies. Timid to try it himself...  64.
Hey, Ass-Burger! Oh, Christ. IT’S E.J. -- the bully from school. Rory turn to go the other way. Finds himself boxed in by:
What’re you supposed to be?
Leave me alone. E.J. Or what -- ? You’ll wash your hands five hundred times? Rory hurries away. The bullies dog his heels, chuckling
Patchy lawn. Porch light OFF. The least inviting house on this or any block. Possible escape..? Rory heads up the steps. Looks back --
On the sidewalk, smirking. No turning back now. Gulp. He RINGS the doorbell. A BUZZ echoes from deep inside...

trick or treat..? A VOICE from behind the door: STONER’S VOICE Fuck off. ON THE SIDEWALK -- E.J. and Derek CHORTLE with amusement. Taking the hint, Rory turns. Moves stiffly toward the str A door CREAKS OPEN behind him, and... An unfriendly looking STONER appears in the darkened door

Here’s a treat, you little shit. He PITCHES SOMETHING through the air -- Splat! A ROTTEN A SMACKS Rory in the back of the head. Bullies, laughing... The reaction is shockingly swift and spontaneous. PREDATOR MASK POV  65. The interior of the helmet LIGHTS UP. Symbols, scrolling. TARGETING INFORMATION. A tiny PLASMA-CASTER juts forth -- UNLEASHES HELLFIRE.
is literally DISINTEGRATED as the doorway BLOWS OUT

EXT. A BLOCK AWAY - McKENNA AND CASEY see the EXPLOSION. Trade alarmed looks -- and RUN -- EXT. STONER’S HOUSE - NIGHT The front lawn, SMOKING. Rory turns toward the slack- jawed bullies, his face the imposing PREDATOR BIOHELMET. The bullies almost shit their pants before FLEEING in abj terror --! Colored CHERRY LIGHTS flash over the scene --
Rory pulls off the helmet as a ROOKIE COP draws his weapo
Freeze! But Rory panics, RUNS --
And in his panic, DROPS the Predator biohelmet. He can’t turn back -- so he KEEPS RUNNING.
CUTTER at the wheel, as an APB SQUAWKS from:
-- male juvenile, ten to twelve years old, metal Halloween mask -- Cutter grabs his talkie, SHOVES IT at the speaker of the police band radio.
CASEY AND MCKENNA ON THE MOVE. McKenna’s talkie SQUELCHES POLICE BAND RADIO (CONT’D) -- repeat: moving east on Woodruff.  66. McKenna swears. GRABS Casey --
This way. Move.

The PREDATOR DOGS emerge from the shadows. Sniffing. One snatches the FALLEN BIOHELMET in its mandibles -- CUT TO: EXT. STONER’S HOUSE - SAME More POLICE CRUISERS, BLOWING INTO FRAME. They jolt to a stop, just in time to see the ROOKIE COP c running, panting and wheezing. He calls to the new arriva
I lost him! He stops. Puzzled. Looks left -- right -- ROOKIE COP (CONT’D) Where’s my fucking car?
WILLIAMS drives, slews around a corner--! Keys his walkie
Eastbound on Buckingham. The kid’s rabbiting, he’s spooked.
Between houses, terrified, THE KUJHAD clutched in his sweaty hand -- the very thing the Predator’s after.

EXT. JIM & JOHN’S BAR-B-Q - NIGHT RORY rounds a bend. STOPS in his tracks, path blocked by Christ. It’s that fucking PIT BULL -- the one that taunts him on the way home from school. The dog GROWLS. Primal. Then, oddly -- moves RIGHT UP TO RORY. Stops beside him. Rory’s brow furrows with confusion... Then, a decision. He reaches out, tentatively... to pet the dog?  67. The dog doesn’t flinch. Their eyes meet. A sweet, unspoke recognition that they’re not all that different: two eart creatures, just trying to get by. Then the dog FREEZES. A throaty GROWL as it backs away from something OFF-SCREEN, and Rory TURNS TO SEE:
Snarling. Vicious. Rory gapes, thunderstruck -- Now the OTHER PREDATOR DOG appears! Thinking quickly: Rory STABS BUTTONS on the KUJHAD, and with that --
HOLOGRAMS. The Predator dogs RETREAT, fearful. Nice job, Rory. Until the images FLICKER, and FADE. Damn! The sniffers turn toward Rory -- but just then, A VOICE from off-screen:

Son! AND THERE’S HIS DAD, shotgun in hand. McKenna cocks and FIRES at the sniffers -- K-CHUK-BLAMM! K-CHUK-BLAMM! BUT THE SNIFFERS JUST KEEP COMING. A SQUAD CAR SCREAMS into the parking lot and -- WILLIAMS ROLLS OUT onto the pavement before the car’s even stopped Levels the grenade launcher. Click--! Nothing. Fucking thing’s jammed. As he struggles to fix it, the OTHER VETS MOVE IN, loaded for bear. OPEN FIRE on the Predator Dogs. A HAIL STORM OF ARTILLERY--! The Sniffers barely flinch. Just KEEP -- MOVING -- FORWAR MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Um, Gaylord? Williams finishes a final adjustment on the launcher --
I thought I told you -- -- then THROWS IT into McKenna’s waiting hands.

(CONT’D) Call me Nebraska.  68. McKenna SPINS. WHOMMM--! FIRES A 40MM RECOILLESS GRENADE down the Predat dog’s throat. A muted FWHHMPP! from within, and -- The creature BUCKLES. Punch-drunk. Finally topples as... THE SECOND SNIFFER crouches to attack. But that’s when Williams steps forward, a BOLT GUN in hand. He levels it at the creature -- FIRES, AND THE BOLT impales the creature’s forehead. It wavers. List Walks in a lazy circle. Not dead but... no longer a threa Nebraska Williams mutters ruefully: WILLIAMS (CONT’D) Goddamn space aliens. But his triumph is short-lived as he looks to THE POLICE CAR he stole: because standing on top, bathed in the strobing colors of the lightbar is... THE PREDATOR. It STOMPS down the hood of the car, on a bee-line for Ror McKenna pumps the shotgun, unloads: BLAM--! But the thing KEEPS RIGHT ON COMING.
Baxley at the wheel. He GUNS IT -- SLAMS into the Predator from behind at high speed!
Alas, nothing. The front fender is dented, but the Predator? Just glowers at Baxley like it’s irked. Then -- CONTINUES TOWARD RORY... CASEY appears, CALLS out to McKe
That thing in his hand! THAT’S

MCKENNA RUNS -- grapples to wrest the device away from his son. But as always -- THE PREDATOR’S FASTER. The Creature GRABS McKENNA! SLAMS HIM, hard, into an old, neon “Jim & John’s” sign! It CRACKS and SPARKS--!  69. And just as we consider saying good-bye to our lead, McKenna watches, stunned, as the Predator THUMBS A BUTTON on its wrist gauntlet and, believe it or not, TALKS: Guttural. Alien-sounding. But ENGLISH:

Coming... for me... Run... Then -- a throaty CLICKING SOUND. From off-screen. The Predator turns to look. Stiffens; replies, that selfs CLICKING. Defensive. Like two cats YOWLING at each other. The remaining alien DOG pricks up its ears -- looking bac toward the approach of its owner... its MASTER.... At which point, McKenna and the others turn TO SEE:

EMERGING from the darkness. Rising up -- On first viewing, it very much resembles the iconic PREDA It seems, if anything, more HUMAN than prior versions. McKENNA stands, blinking. Because this new, upgraded Predator? It’s HUGE. TEN FEET TALL. With a SHRIEK, THE WINNEBAGO slews into the parking lot, Cutter at the wheel.
as he catches his first glimpse of THE UPGRADE.
Baby Jesus on a pony. Which is when:
THE GOOD PREDATOR RELEASES MCKENNA; raises its PLASMA CANNON-- and TRIGGERS A WITHERING BLAST at the Upgrade--!
Then another. And ANOTHER..! Nothing. Bupkis. Spit wads. Because this new, UPGRADED Predator? Doesn’t need armor. Its body, its skin -- IS armor.
Stock still. In shock. McKenna approaches --  70.
Rory? Come on. Rory doesn’t budge. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Son? We have to go. RIGHT... FUCKING... NOW... No time for negotiations, McKenna PICKS UP HIS SON, backing slowly toward

Where Cutter is frozen, gripping the wheel. McKenna and the others board the vehicle slowly; no sudden movements. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) How fast does this thing go? Cutter can’t tear his away eyes from the upgrade.
Not fast enough.

As the GOOD PREDATOR MOVES! As if to engage the upgrade - to take him on. But that’s what’s scary. Because we thoug our INITIAL Predator was a big deal. Invincible. But this As Cutter STOMPS the gas, the UPGRADE PREDATOR WHIPS AROU -- COLLARS the smaller Predator -- HEFTS it -- LITERALLY TEARS IT APART BEFORE OUR EYES.

WRENCHES its spine loose -- RAISES ITS BLOOD-SLICKED TROP to the full moon. Emits a primal, blood-chilling SHRIEK. It spins toward the Winnebago -- turns its eyes on us full blast -- and that’s when we see it. REALLY see it: The EYES. They’ve... evolved. Human-looking.
Cutter GUNS IT--! and we INTERCUT:
as the Winnebago SCREAMS along, SWERVING, clipping parked cars -- OUR PRINCIPALS gawking out the windows at:  71.
of THE UPGRADE, in pursuit -- darting, leaping -- SPRINTING through the shadows alongside the SPEEDING RV. Speed, agility? Terrifying. The term “Predator” redefined
CASEY, apoplectic, points at THE KUJHAD Rory’s still hold

Goddammit, McKenna, that’s what it wants! That thing! A massive CRUNCH! as the huge vehicle JARS VIOLENTLY. It’s trying to get in. RORY’s curled up in a fetal ball. Not a fire alarm this t but rather, CRIPPLING FEAR that’s triggered his shutdown. And the Predator device--? He’s clutching it, as if for dear life. CASEY (CONT’D) For Christ’s sake, GIVE IT TO HIM OR WE’RE ALL DEAD! McKenna knows she’s right. And with sudden, terrifying fo violently PRIES HIS SON’S FIST OPEN to wrench it free--! Rory YELPS with pain and surprise as McKenna HURLS THE KU OUT an open window -- ! EVERYONE squints out the back of the Winnebago, glimpsing
as it scrambles for THE KUJHAD, and... SNAPS IT into the on ITS OWN wrist gauntlet. A last nightmarish glance at our escaping heroes -- then DISAPPEARS into the night...

The group just stares blankly, speechless. The only sound, the rhythmic RATTLE of the RV’s Chevy 454 engine. RORY winces, hands shaking. Afraid to look at McKenna. Le terrified of the Predator than the violence inflicted by his father. He HEARS BARKING, and --  72.

Now maybe Rory’s only friend, chasing the Winnebago and BARKING into the night... CUT TO: EXT. JIM AND JOHN’S BAR-B-Q- NIGHT TRAEGER stands over the gnarled remains of the “good” Predator. POLICE and FBI VEHICLES form a perimeter. With trembling hand, he clutches a cell phone, says:
Traeger here. The asset’s dead.
A stocky, four-star GENERAL, on the phone. Square-jawed, with vaguely malevolent, dark eyes. This is WOODHURST, 66
Explain.
There’s a new player, sir. Our nightmare scenario. The genetics are... unprecedented.
An upgrade?
Affirmative. Pulled our asset apart like a piece of taffy.
Jesus... (ice cold) You spooks over at Stargazer -- you were going to tell me you had an asset in captivity, weren’t you..? Funny how I was only notified once it had escaped.
Of course, sir. It had only been 72 hours, we were ascertaining --
Shut up.
Sir, I --  73.
Shut up. (beat) Lies are wasted speech. You cross me again, I won’t just kill you, I’1l1 sell tickets. Understood?
Understood... General.
The asset brought something to earth. Something it wasn’t supposed to have. Find it. Then bring it to me.

Very late now. The WINNEBAGO, cached in a grove of TREES. Crickets chirrup, peaceful... a breather, in other words. McKENNA’s perched in a TREE. On watch. Glances down at: RORY, huddled among the loonies, drawing in the dirt with a stick. The poor kid’s shivering; barely holding it together.

We see what he’s absently etching with his stick, oblivio -- it’s a crude MAP. And: we’ve seen it before... CUT TO: INT. RORY’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - NIGHT And a RINGING cell phone -- the burner McKenna gave Emily. Frantic with worry, she GRABS IT! HEARS: MCKENNA’S PHONE VOICE (filtered) It’s me.
Please tell me he’s okay.
McKenna, on the ground now, clutching a cell phone. Williams, having a smoke nearby.
He’s fine, he’s with me. I’1l1 bring him home when it’s -- Emily’s eyes flicker off-screen, uneasy.
It’s okay, you don’t have to explain. Listen -- remember our first date..? McKenna, baffled.
That night in Buckhead?
Exactly. And with that, she hangs up. No explanation. McKenna frowns. WIF? Williams looks at him, quizzical.
“Night in Buckhead?”

(nods; remembering) Yeah... we were going at it in my Trans Am that night, and -- Sudden realization. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) cops were watching us... INT. RORY’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - REVEALING His ex is, indeed, SURROUNDED BY BLACK OPS TECHNICIANS with surveillance equipment. Before they can stops her: Emily POPS the phone’s SIM card, DROPS It into the sink’s garbage disposal -- flicks on the water and the disposal.
You guys fucked with the wrong family.
THE LOONIES are now climbing on and around the Winnebago, stretching camouflage netting over it. RORY watches.
I don’t think that’s gonna work.  75.
What do you mean?
Wrong colors, wrong pattern. They’11 find us. McKenna appears behind him. Puts a hand on his shoulder.
I think they know what they’ re doing. Rory FLINCHES at the touch, and McKenna quickly withdraws

NETTLES walks the perimeter, armed. Suddenly -- a familiar, blood-chilling CLICKING--! HE WHIPS around. But nothing. Shrubs. Dirt. Sudden SILENCE. Then -- THE CLICKING’S CLOSER! Nettles SPINS -- A FLASH O THE PREDATOR DOG’S FACE fills the frame, as...
McKenna and Rory, sitting side by side. Awkward. To break the tension, McKenna fishes in a pocket, produce set of DOG TAGS. He hands them to Rory, who fingers them: COLLETT, RORY T.

The kid looks at his dad, confused. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Friend of mine. From... An involuntary glance at the TEETH MARKS on his hand. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) from a long time ago. Rory clutches the odd gift; oblivious to its significance
Weird, us having the same name.
Yeah. (smiles) Funny, huh?  76. Pause... then:
Mom says... you’re a killer.
I’m a soldier.
What’s the difference..? Good question. McKenna looks at his son.
When you like it -- that’s when you’re a killer.
(nods) Mom likes killing spiders.
I hate spiders.
(nods) This is the most we’ve talked. Pause... almost companionable. Then: RORY (CONT’D) I think it was a good guy.
(bewildered) Excuse me?
The alien. The smaller one. He was trying to save us from the big one. Almost like there’s two sides. (beat) Maybe they’re having a war. McKenna feels a sober chill...
Tenses, hearing something in the woods. He SPINS, levels his M16 into the darkness.

Company’s coming.  77. Which is when NETTLES BURSTS OUT OF THE BRUSH -- followed by that goddamn PREDATOR DOG! The surviving one; the one with the bolt in its forehead. But the group quickly realizes: it’s not chasing him. It’s merely following him.
Anybody got a goddamn Milk Bone? They watch curiously as the thing wanders like an obedient (if addled) puppy.

Jesus, Nebraska, you lobotomized the poor sumbitch. The Predator Dog starts toward Rory. Instantly fearful, the kid GRABS a gnarled piece of wood and HURLS IT at the creature! It DUCKS -- turns to look a the fallen branch. Then... PADS AWAY to retrieve it. In seconds, it RETURNS to Nettles and DROPS IT at his fee

Well, I’1l be go-to-hell. He reaches to “pet” the thing. Gently takes its dreadlock-like appendages in his hand. THE SNIFFER reacts oddly. Suddenly disoriented. The group LAUGHS. Even Rory smiles; a moment of respite. Camaraderi
McKENNA enters. Gets himself a beer. CASEY says:
Nice kid. McKenna nods thanks. Sits. CASEY (CONT’D) You know... a lot of experts think being on the spectrum’s not a disorder. Some think it might even be the next evolutionary step.
All I know is, when his gram comes over, he ignores her and hugs a pillow she made.  78.
