It’s the same love. Just deflected. (cautiously If I can offer an opinion... maybe you're a little bit afraid of each other? He shakes his head, rueful.
Nice spin, but... I think we’re both afraid of me. He takes a swig of his beer.
THE VETS continue to play with the beast’s DREADS. As the touched, the Sniffer goes slack, wobbly. Like he’s stoned
McKenna, watching this through the window.
What do you make of those--? (gestures to his hair:) The Marley shit?
Maybe sensory receptors. Like... cat whiskers.
(sips his beer) Anything else, professor? She looks at him grimly --

Just this. -- and produces THE VIAL she stole from the lab. CASEY (CONT’D) They extracted this from the Predator’s spinal fluid. In layman’s terms, it’s like distilled “lizard brain.” The part that kicks in under extreme survival conditions.
Remember I told you they rip out peoples’ spines?
Sure. Trophies, you said.
Right. But if a Predator’s first and foremost a survivor-- (beat) Wouldn’t it make sense to collect DNA “souvenirs”?
From... peoples’ spines?
Brain stem -- close enough. Look suppose, just suppose, that these space creatures are... siphoning off our lizard brain juice.
You don’t have to overdo the “layman’s terms” --
I’m just saying... it might explain the human DNA.
McKenna considers this.
Collecting “survival” traits, from the most high-end human specim --

(interrupting) Why stop there? Seriously -- why not other species, too? (beat) Extreme hybridization. That’s why they hunt. To extract the defense mechanisms from the strongest, the smartest, the most dangerous species on every planet they visit...
To make hybrids. (looks up, stunned) Are you just pulling this out of your ass?  80.
This new Predator, the bigger one -- it didn’t need a mask, you notice that? And did you see its fucking eyes? (beat) They’ re evolving, Lieutenant. Changing.
Or being upgraded.

And here’s the clincher. (leans in) Project Stargazer? The shit- show that recruited me? Mckenna shrugs: What about it? CASEY (CONT’D) A stargazer’s a type of flower; an orchid. And not just any orchid --
Holy shit... (softly) A hybrid. Damn. McKenna gets up. Pacing. It’s a lot to digest.

That thing back there... the new one, “Thing Two”? Probably top of the line. “Thing One”? Last year’s model. (re: the sniffer) Old Yeller out there’s another kind. But none of them is the essential Predator. You know why? Because survival is. Because this -- She holds up the vial, locks eyes with McKenna. CASEY (CONT’D) This is the Predator. A SOUND rises outside. Distant WHORPLE of chopper blades. McKenna’s up like a shot.
McKenna bursts outside -- looks to Flyboy, who’s stock still, gauging the sound of the incoming copter:  81.
Sounds like a Pave Hawk. Sikorsky. (looks at McKenna) Not civilian. All McKenna needs to hear. He whirls round --

Lights out! MOVE--! THE LOONIES SCRAMBLE to turn off lanterns as McKenna DIVE into the Winnebago; renders it dark. Everyone freezes... THE SIKORSKY ROARS OVERHEAD, a blinding SEARCHLIGHT rakin the woods. Slowly, the SOUND diminishes. Then... THE COPTER TURNS. Start back in their direction. Shit! McKenna looks around. As the ersatz C.0O., it’s on him to a plan. He looks at his “men.” Motley as they seem, they’ SERVICEMEN, U.S. Vets. And they’re nothing if not loyal.
(CONT’D) Best split up. (to Nettles) You and Flyboy, west. (to Baxley and Coyle) You two north.
But -- what do we do? And McKenna sees in their faces: they don’t want to go. He grasps at straws to give them something. A mission.

(to Flyboy) We’1ll need air transport. Something that can outrun that Pave Hawk. (looks at Nettles) And maybe some incendiaries. Never know when we could use a diversion. Roger that? And that’s when: The Loonies, God bless ‘em, SALUTE MCKENNA. He looks at them, abruptly moved. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Wish I had coordinates, but...
We’1ll find you, sir.  82. McKenna nods. SNAPS back a salute. And with that, the LOO DISPERSE; grabbing weapons, disappearing into the woods.
(to McKenna) They know it’s a snipe hunt, right? Rory’s observed this whole exchange. A tentative VOICE:
What’s a snipe hunt?
When you’re chasing something you’ll never find.

(urgent) Come on. They turn to make a run for it. Get five yards before they’re STARTLED by: The PREDATOR DOG; gnarled stick clenched in its mandibles Try as it might to be adorable, it’s one ugly motherfucke As the HELICOPTER grows louder, Casey makes frantic “shoo ing” motions. But the Sniffer isn’t taking the hint. She spies an errant GRENADE on the ground, SNATCHES IT UP And LOBS it as far as she can, into a ravine. The Sniffer drops the wood and RACES after it. Problem solved. Except --
Is now circling the clearing. GOD-LIGHT, stabbing down --
Touching down. (Loonies and Sniffer, long gone.) TRAEGER steps down from the chopper, wind WHIPPING. His m DRAW WEAPONS on Williams and Cutter, as...

(re: Winnebago) Whose idea was the jungle camo? McKenna glances at Rory, who shrugs -- told you so.  83. TRAEGER (CONT’ D) Should have used Woodland. Might as well have shot up a signal flare. He approaches Casey. Regards her with a grin, then -- ext his open palm. After a beat, she stiffly hands him THE VI TRAEGER (CONT’ D) There, now. That wasn’t so hard. His men rudely PAT DOWN McKenna and the others. TRAEGER (CONT’ D) Where is it?
Where’s what?
The device. It goes -- (mimes Predator’s wrist gauntlet) -- right in here.
We threw it out of the RV. That thing has it.
Traeger ponders.
You know what I think? I think it’s time for some... robust discussion.

MCKENNA’S FACE CRACK--! It SLAMS into the ground! Pummeled, caked with dirt. Purplish welts glisten, backlit by searchlights. It'll take a minute, but eventually you’1ll get it: we ar in an abandoned abattoir. A SLAUGHTERHOUSE.
McKENNA, on his knees. TWO BLACK-CLAD MERCS loom over him
You hid it once. In the mail. Where’d you hide it this time?
A BRUTAL KICK for emphasis. McKenna COUGHS blood.  84. MERC (CONT’D) This is getting old, Lieutenant. Cough up some more blood if you agree. Another KICK--! McKenna writhes in the mud... CUT TO:
CASEY, handcuffed to a chair. A few feet away, Traeger pours himself a drink. Holds up the bottle:
Can I tempt you, Ms. Brackett?
(exasperated) Just tell me, why are they fucking HERE? If it’s not to hunt, then WHY? Traeger regards her coolly, shrugs, smiles:
Ms. Brackett, do you remember a few years back when Hostess went bust? There was a run on Twinkies. Snapped up, coast to coast. “Get ‘em while they last”, remember?
What are you saying, we’re Twinkies?
(shrugs) Think about it. How long before climate change makes the planet unlivable? Two generations? One? Casey’s blinks -- dawning realization:
Jesus. We’re an endangered species, and they know it. That’s why they keep coming here -- they want to snap up our best DNA before it goes bye-bye.
Exactly. Adapt themselves with it, then... move in. Casey blinks, stunned.  85.
What about their own planet?
We think it’s dying. (frowns) Well -- cooling, to be precise.
You read the file, they thrive in a hot-house environment. Maybe they want to make a move to ours. It is getting warmer, you know.
Casey shudders.
And your angle -- the upgrade tech, am I right?
(shrugs) If we can upgrade ourselves? Become the ultimate survival engines--? Why wouldn’t we? Casey looks sick to her stomach.
How would you disseminate it? Who gets it?
Whoever can afford it, of course. He grabs her by the hair. Yanks tightly. TRAEGER (CONT’ D) Now something is on that hijacked ship, and I think you know what it is...

A rail system circles the room with meat hooks on it. In one corner, a group of CRYPTOGRAPHERS study the famili PREDATOR HIEROGLYPHICS on a large DRY ERASE BOARD. RORY SITS nearby, drawing with crayons. A lone GUARD keep watch on. Glances at Rory’s drawing. Says, offhandedly:
What’s that? Rory shrugs; doesn’t look up.  86.
Map.
Map of what?
Where the ark is. The CHATTER in the room STOPS. All eyes on Rory. A CRYPTOGRAPHER approaches him, slow. Smiles tentatively. Points at the drawing, says:
Um... do you mind if I..? Another shrug from Rory. Whatever. The Cartographer takes the “map” to the Team Leader.
LEADER (sotto) Are you insane? He’s a kid --
A kid who had that biohelmet for twenty-four hours.

Even if the ship is there, we still need the key to get in, the entry code’s on the fucking KEY. He gestures at the dry erase board; DOZENS of attempts to translate the Predator language into letters or numbers. TEAM LEADER (CONT’D) That sequence could be a hundred digits, for all we know--! RORY’S VOICE (0.S.) Twenty-two. Every head in the room turns to:
I’m pretty sure it’s twenty-two. You can hear a pin drop.
Traeger approaches Rory, feigning nonchalance. Attempts a paternal tone:  87.

Hi, Rory. I’m Will. I understand you know how to access the spaceship. Rory nods, tense. Bites his lip. Traeger grins. TRAEGER (CONT’D) Here’s the thing. We work for the United States Government. Just like your dad.
Except you’re assholes. Traeger’s grin slips. Then he plasters it back on. Holds up Rory’s drawing: the MAP.
I won’t argue. Question is... will you get me into this ship, or not? Rory stiffens, wary.
If you let my dad go. Traeger glances at his lackeys. “Kid’s good.” He leans in

Okay. You want to play grown-up, let’s play grown-up. Man to man..? We’re not going to let him go. Not until you give us what we want. But when you do -- I promise he’1l go back to the V.A. hospital... where they will take good care of him.
What if I don’t tell you? Traeger shakes his head with disappointment; tsk tsk tsk.
Oh, now, Rory... I thought we were playing grown-up.
McKenna, face in the dirt. Groggy. Barely conscious. SEES
being dragged to a waiting Sikorsky. Fueled, blades spinn  88. MCKENNA STARTS TO MOVE, when suddenly --
Not so fast, slick. THWACK--! Another KICK to his gut. THOSE FUCKING MERCS, standing over him. He watches helplessly as
Lifts off, WHORPLES into the night sky. As it does, one o the mercs draws his sidearm to END this, says to his budd
Golf tomorrow?
Why not? McKenna sees what he’s doing -- COUGHS. Ropey spits of bl
You know what... burns me up..? (gasp, cough) You never even... read my file, did you..? The mercs trade amused glances.
What makes you think that?
‘Cause you’re makin’ plans... for tomorrow. The mercs, VERY amused by this. MCKENNA (CONT’D) Worst part? Is you... making me lie to my son. I really don’t like to do that.
What lie did you tell him? McKENNA, face to camera, grins:

That I wouldn’t enjoy this. That’s when his HAND DARTS OUT, SNATCHES the guy’s forear uses his other hand for leverage, and -- Crack--!  89. The MERC SCREAMS as McKenna SNAPS HIS FOREARM at an alarm angle, then GRABS the man’s gun, presses it into his eye BLAM--! The MERC DROPS WITH A THUD as McKenna stands, levels the sidearm at the remaining MERC; frozen in place Like the Predator in the lab, he was playing possum.

A walk-in. Williams and Cutter, sitting on the floor. They LOOK UP TO SEE: THE MERC opening the thick, industrial door; McKenna holds him at gunpoint, says to the guy: MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Now the armory.
A MERC rounds a corner -- BYES GO WIDE. HIS POV -- the MAN McKENNA KILLED, wedged into a corner. The guy turns to raise an alarm -- STOPS. His eyes widen. AN INHUMAN SHAPE, LOOMING over him.
A GUN at the back of CASEY’S HEAD. She closes her eyes, waits for the shot -- As, abruptly, we hear loud clumping noises from the corridor outside. FOOTFALLS, as

Pokes his head around the corner. Snuffling, drooling. As benign as it is INHUMAN: THE PREDATOR DOG. The sniffer. Wagging its tail, no less. Sees Casey, the intended targe of its current game-in-progress... and FYI, in its mouth? THE GRENADE from the clearing. It’s FETCHED it. Brought it back. It DROPS the grenade -- CLUNK! -- right in Casey’s lap. Her ASSASSIN, stupefied.. Casey wastes no time:  90. SNATCHES UP the grenade -- pulls the pin -- SHOVES IT down the guard’s SHIRT BACK. Promptly BOLTS FOR THE DOOR, dragging the CHAIR she’s handcuffed to --

Hits the deck as -- FWOOM!! -- the room BLOWS OUT BEHIND Blood and dust and dry wall. Smoke clears, and... THE PREDATOR DOG pads out of the room, unscathed. Drops a new toy at her feet. Wait, sorry. Not a toy. The GUARD’S SEVERED HEAD. Casey throws up a little in her mouth as she hears FOOTFA SEES McKENNA, WILLIAMS, CUTTER (in his wheelchair) come around a corner, armed to the teeth.
McKenna opens the door a crack. PEERS OUT: HIS POV: SOLDIERS run around the perimeter, taking up firing positions to prevent their escape. McKenna, Williams and Cutter trade looks. Shrug.
Duck soap. Piece of cake. They LOCK AND LOAD, no hesitation. CASEY gapes. It’s suic
See this? THIS is why the army thinks you’re crazy! Except... a SOUND now. A low pulse; BASS VIBRATO from outside. MCKENNA peers through the crack again... and his eyes widen. An involuntarily gasp.
You’ve got to be kidding me.

FLAPPING in the wind. And on it, an airbrushed, scantily girl (“A New Look for Sexy!”) being pulled by... A PINK HELICOPTER. Yes, pink. The Victoria’s Secret logo on the side, no less, as we REVEAL:  91.
FLYBOY AT THE HELM, of course. The other VETS (NETTLES, BAXLEY, COYLE) in the back. THE LOONIES to the rescue!
As the pink copter LANDS unsteadily and
McKenna SHOVES IT OPEN, and... OUR HEROES RUN FOR IT, into the open, GUNS BLAZING--! Williams PUSHES THE WHEELCHAIR at high speed; Cutter’s M6 CHATTERING as hot shell casings SPIT out the side -- !
McKenna and Williams provide COVERING FIRE as Casey and t Loonies HEFT CUTTER ABOARD, then -- YANK HIS WHEELCHAIR I
This chopper was built for five people. Current load? EIG Plus a wheelchair. Lufthansa, it ain’t. As FLYBOY LIFTS O MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Very inconspicuous.
We had to kill seven Victoria’s Secret models.
Tell me you’re joking.
I’m joking. I’d sooner piss on the Mona Lisa. He throttles up, pulls up on the collective.
As the copter rises, MERCS OPEN FIRE. Too little, too lat
Flyboy looks to McKenna for direction. FLYBOY (CONT’D) You got a heading in mind, Lieutenant?  92. McKenna squints down at the rushing landscape. Casey poin
hauling ass, SOUTHBOUND.
Follow that dog.

On first blush, we’re back in Cuba. Same tropical foliage same humidity, same goddamn mosquitoes. Then we HEAR: TRUDGING BOOTS. CRACKLE of radio crosstalk. And that’s when we note: a long BUMPY GREEN ROCK. Wait a minute. Did it just... move? Yes, it did. Because it’s not a rock. It’s a fucking ALLIGATOR -- Because we’re in FLORIDA. The gator sinks into the swamp

from the brush, flanked by A SMALL ARMY OF MERCS; poor Rory in tow. An AIDE clutches a hand-held GPS device. TRAEGER’S AIDE We’re at the waypoint. Should be right here. But the clearing is just that: clear. Then, Traeger notic
What are those? They’ re DEAD BIRDS, laying on the jungle floor in a wide

Examines them. Nudges one with his boot. He SPITS to the side, and -- splat! The spittle HANGS THERE IN MID-AIR. Traeger sees this. Intrigued. Turns to a MERC. TRAEGER (CONT’D) Give me your weapon. (takes the gun) Paint pellets. The soldier scoops some glycol pellets, hands them over. Traeger loads them -- FIRES, twice. THOOK! THOOK!  93. Eerily, the TWO SPLATS OF PAINT stay frozen in the air, COATING AN INVISIBLE SURFACE. Traeger points: TRAEGER (CONT’D)

The entire brigade OPENS FIRE with a BLISTERING FUSILLADE RORY clamps his hands over his ears, SCREAMS silently. Under the bombardment, a series of spastic SHIMMERS as, BEFORE OUR EYES... THE PREDATOR SPACECRAFT APPEARS--! Its cloaking device short-circuited by the assault. Soldiers gape as -- Traeger tenses. Looks around. Where’s the Predator? But nothing. Silence. A thin smile of triumph:

(CONT’D) We beat it here. (to his aide) Get on the horn. Tell Woodhurst we have his space ship. He turns to Rory -- ushers the boy forward, gripping his shoulder. SHOVES HIM toward -- THE SHIP’S ENTRYWAY And next to the hatch... an ALIEN CODE BOX. TRAEGER (CONT’ D) Open it. Rory hesitates. Feeling all eyes on him, he relents. Reac for the code box. TWO DOZEN DUMBSTRUCK SOLDIERS look on - As a little boy inputs the code from memory. SH-KKK! As easy as that, the HATCH OPENS. Traeger turns to his AIDE. Points. You’re coming, too.
A cavernous THRUM oscillates as Traeger looks around, petrified. The technology is clearly alien. Then he notic
INSET around the periphery of the hold. TRAEGER’S AIDE What the hell are they?

Property of Project Stargazer, that’s what they are. (to his aide) Tell the men to secure the craft; get it ready for transport. I want it moving before that... THING gets here. RORY, meanwhile, has noticed a control panel:
On it, THE GRAPHIC depicted in our opening. The stasis cylinders HIGHLIGHTED IN RED with time-code beside them. Except the COUNTDOWN has stopped, MID-SEQUENCE...
No longer morning, it’s late in the day... MCKENNA and CASEY, eyeing the rolling country below. Palmettos, swampland -- and, galloping in and out of sight: THE SNIFFER. McKenna whispers:
Go, baby, go. Run to papa. Casey frowns. Points below, WHERE:
has STOPPED; visible now on a low hill overlooking a road closure, beyond which: some kind of activity. McKENNA raises his binocs:

Not just “activity” -- it’s THE ARK. Currently in transit THE ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS SWARM round a huge FLATBED TR removing tarp from the spacecraft. Showers of SPARKS as t solder towing rings; LASH steel cables.
Flyboy pops a wad of bubble gum, says:  95.
Looks like they got it this far by truck. Now they’re prepping to airlift it in. Seeing something, Casey grabs McKenna’s binocs.
In the eye of the hurricane, giving orders.
There’s that asshole, Traeger. McKenna goes taut.
That means Rory’s down there. (to Flyboy Take us down. FLYBOY banks sharply, descends into the trees, as we --
being strapped to a palmetto tree with wire:
A FIVE YEAR-OLD kid, cowlick, cutoffs, licking a Popsicle, watches a SOLDIER put the sign up.

where a dozen or so RESIDENTS have set up beach chairs to watch. Not a lot to do in the trailer park, apparently. GIRLS IN BIKINIS man A CUBAN FOOD TRUCK; boom-box BLARING A terrible Ricky Ricardo caricature advertises CUBAN PETE’S. Then a bone-jarring BASS RATTLE as --
OUR MERRY BAND (McKenna, Casey, et al) crouched in the trees near the trailer park, LOOKING SKYWARD as --

head_text.subj: TWO BORING VERTOL HEAVY LIFTING HELICOPTERS, (HLH)

text: THUNDER overhead, en route to The Ark.  96.
Heavy lifting copters. It’s an airlift, all right. The massive copters WHORPLE over an adjacent CRACKER BARREL restaurant.
We’ve gotta get closer to the perimeter. Blend in somehow.
(scoffs) Like this? He gestures to the group, FESTOONED with AK’s, AR- 15’s, holstered glocks -- not to mention TRANQ GUNS.
Stand out like a sore thumb.

Yeah? When’s the last time you stopped in a crowd and said, “Hey, that guy over there -- his thumb looks sore.” Be honest. (beat) Fine. We bag the guns. Across the road, the CRACKER BARREL’S DOORS OPEN: And out trudge three men, ALL STRAPPED to the fucking tee Assault rifles. Pistols. They wave heartily at McKenna, h a bucket of chicken --
Y’all hungry? A ten year-old GIRL scrambles from under the porch, sporting a CROSSBOW and a .44 Magnum.
Florida... We’re blending.
Hey, you wanna blend more? Shoot the kid. Claim “Stand Your Ground.”
Stab a gator and you’1ll be practically invisible.  97.
(exasperated) We done?
One more. (thinks, changes his mind) Nah, we’re done.

Our heroes troop into the bustling TRAILER PARK, approach the CUBAN PETE TRUCK. MCKENNA clocks the back of the truck, covered in ANTI-GOVERNMENT SLOGANS -- banners, placards. MCKENNA (to Casey; sotto) You still have your Stargazer 1.D.? She nods, hands it over with apprehension:
You’ re gonna do something stupid, aren’t you? McKenna and Williams trade conspiratorial grins.
Lady? You haven’t seen stupid yet.
A fenced-off patch of SOD next to the truck hosts a few struggling tomatoes. The PROPRIETER (“PETE”) tends it. MCKENNA approaches.
Sir--? PROPRIETER (“PETE”) Call me Pete. What can I do for you?
Well, Pete, my name’s McKenna. Until recently, I worked for the U.S. Government -- He flashes Casey’s (temporary) government credentials.  98.

-- for THOSE people. (points toward the quarantine signs) Well, guess what, brother? They’re at it again. A cover-up. You think that’s really a toxic leak in those woods? ’ PETE” What, then? McKenna adopts a solemn look.
What if I told you... there’s something in those trees, and it ain’t no man. Cuban Pete tenses. \ PETE” It’s Bigfoot, isn’t it?

RORY is still inside the spacecraft, under guard. He explores... casts his eyes round the interior, notices: An EQUIPMENT ALCOVE. And in it... a PREDATOR BIO-MASK like the one he wore on Halloween. He reaches for it --

HEY! Don’t touch that! Rory JUMPS. Backs away, intimidated -- and meanwhile: EXT. DIRT ROAD - SAME The two MASSIVE HELICOPTERS hover overhead, deafening -- RAPPELLING LINES unfurl -- SPECIALISTS RAPPEL down, like a SWAT TEAM. Tactical. Professional. And meanwhile --

Heat. Cicadas. TWO SOLDIERS on a JEEP -- manning a ROADBLOCK. They HEAR the roar of an engine, look up. WTF? THE “CUBAN PETE” TRUCK  99. comes BARRELING AT THEM, terrible CUBAN DISCO BLARING, breeches the perimeter, and --
The food truck TRUNDLES INTO VIEW at high speed--! SOLDIERS CONVERGE, flagging it down. Shouts, cursing -- l your bowels after a Cuban Pete’s supper, this is all high irregular, as --
DROPS from an open floor hatch, IMPACTS the dirt, and -- quickly ROLLS OUT OF SIGHT, commando-style --
WRENCHES the truck to a halt, at which point:
Come piling from within, all with laden trays of hot CUBA FOOD. Soldiers, agape -- one of the girls flashes a GRIN:
Y'all brave boys gotta eat, right? The OFFICER IN CHARGE steps forward, apoplectic:
We have plenty of damn FOOD, now get this thing turned around --
He watches through a sniper scope. Speaks into a throat m
Shit. We went from Victoria’s Secret to this?
BAXLEY spits, says:

Relax. These guys are mercs-for- hire, they’d fuck a woodpile on the off chance there’s a snake in it. (suddenly) Whoa. BAXLEY’S POV:  100. From the TRUCK, now, emerges a FOURTH girl. Daisy Dukes, tied up shirt-top... long, blonde (borrowed) WIG -- CASEY, no less. She sashays PAST armed men, DO-SI-DOS right up to the officer in charge -- extends a hand -- Pulls him into a DANCE. Salsa, rumba -- something. The girls cheer. The surrounding soldiers, guns wavering, as
TRAEGER looks out upon the scene, aghast:
What in blue fuck is going on? TRAEGER’S AIDE Locals, sir. We’re on it.
A LONE SOLDIER trots toward the truck. Muttering, shaking his head... Steps round a thicket -- An ARM lashes out. PULLS HIM IN. McKenna’s coal- blackened face, inches from his --
Where’s the boy?
MUSIC, blaring. Girls dancing. Then, suddenly, Casey’s wristwatch goes BEEP-! Her head snaps round -- she SHOUTS

From the FOOD CONTAINER at her side, she lets drop a spherical object. It bounces..! Shit. SMOKE GRENADE. Pop--! Smoke, BILLOWING. Choking. Cuban Pete’s THREE DAUGHTERS, on it. Three quick tosses, Pop-! Pop-! Pop-! They drop flat, hands on their heads -- SMOKE EVERYWHERE. Cloying. TWO SOLDIERS stagger, looking for a target, when -- THUP!THUP! Both of them DROP LIKE SANDBAGS, thanks to:  101. WILLIAMS -- hidden under the FOOD TRUCK -- wielding @ TRANQUILIZER GUN, and --
swiftly TASES the OFFICER in the side. He goes down -- sh drops with him -- liberates his SIDEARM, rolls away --
Chiming in with additional SMOKE CHARGES, as

SLAMS open the food truck’s REAR DOOR, kicks loose two PROPANE TANKS, sets them rolling -- Snaps a rifle to his shoulder, and as they bounce and tumble, FIRES--! DETONATES BOTH. They go up with a whooooosh--! Cascading flame... Debris, raining down --
Emerges from his COMMAND POST to a scene of chaos. SMOKE everywhere. Flame. He BARKS into his talkie:
IT! (to his Aide) Bring me the boy. Now. At which point, we abruptly (and oddly) CUT TO:
A space. Cramped, disorienting -- where are we? Then, a familiar, TALON-LIKE HAND raises an equally famil device (THE KUJHAD). Commences tapping out a code --

TRAEGER’S AIDE appears at the hatch. Physically GRABS the GUARD posted to keep an eye on Rory: TRAEGER’S AIDE We’re taking ‘er up! Where’s the kid? They both scan the interior... shit. Where did he go? Not far. He steps out from the EQUIPMENT ALCOVE -- now wearing the Predator mask he found.  102. The mask’s tiny PLASMA-CASTER swivels, whrrrrrr--! A volley of energy BLOWS THE TWO MEN OUT THE OPEN HATCH!
Rory starts to go. TRIPS -- falls, drops the MASK, it bounces away -- he looks up, cocks his head: A HATCH OPENING behind him. A familiar, blood-chilling CLICKING SOUND, as...
EMERGES, fetus-like from a FLOOR COMPARTMENT. He’s been concealed aboard the ship the whole time.

THE NINE-FOOT PREDATOR RISES... towering. Ghastly. Rory scrambles to his feet. LEAPS out the hatchway -- EXT. “ARK” - CONTINUOUS -- hits the ground running. And screaming. And flailing. But at least he’s OUTSIDE. And that’s when
In his path. Literally comes alive, like a CREATURE -- AS McKENNA STANDS Trailing dirt. The SOD from the trailer park GARDEN strap to his back. Face blackened. Eyes feral. He clutches his
Easy, buddy. It’s me. Dad. Rory nods. McKenna looks up, STARTLED, as -- a FIGURE charges out of the smoke. It’s CASEY.
Suffuses the air... low. Ominous -- Uh-oh. They look toward the SHIP, as it commences to VIBRATE -- oh, shit.

HATCHES begin to open. All around the exterior. Metal doors SLIDING UPWARD -- dark inside. Beckoning. A CLATTER of assault rifles, SOLDIERS level their weapons THAT’S WHEN THE HYBRIDS EMERGE FROM THEIR PODS..!
SWARMING. Some on four legs, some three. Some upright -- others SCUTTLING like crabs. So much smoke, so hard to se
The soldiers BLINDLY OPEN FIRE--!

THE HYBRIDS CARVE A PATH THROUGH THE SOLDIERS--! Obscenel SHRIEKING as they’re pelted with bullets. Never stopping McKENNA AND CASEY Desperately casting around for a hiding place -- it’s RORY who grabs his Dad’s arm, POINTS:
What is it, son?
In there. The empty tubes. McKenna blinks. Brilliant. The VACATED CRYOTUBES, hatches wide open. He grabs Casey and the kid, bundles them insid
He SPOONS with Casey. Cradling his son, close. Hiding. Th bear hug he longed for? Now a survival tool. RORY cracks one eyelid, unable to not look:
Of the ship’s INTERSTELLAR PASSENGERS roaming the mist, killing. Each different, but all expressing a common trai The trademark mottled skull and mandibles of THE PREDATOR

The HERO LOONY, shepherding GIRLS into the taco truck. Swinging up into the DRIVER’S SEAT, except... Something between TUSK AND TALON comes through the windshield. Rory SHUTS HIS EYES; bye-bye, Nettles.
Here he comes. Golem-like. Looming. Stalking majestically from the main hatchway as...

Converge on him. GATHERING. Circling their leader in ragg formation -- almost a MILITARY greeting. An unspoken orde from the UPGRADE -- and with that, off they go, loping aw Vanishing into the surrounding trees.
McKENNA turns to Rory:

Are you... are you okay? Mckenna frowns. No answer. Rory’s not looking at him. He’s looking UP. Petrified... because they’re not alone. Something’s in here with them. McKenna follows his gaze. A low animal CHITTERING, all too familiar... above them, hanging UPSIDE DOWN: not a holographic projection, but the real deal -- A SPIDER/PREDATOR HYBRID.
They all SCRAMBLE OUT. SPIN back around, panicked, as THE HYBRID APPEARS. Poised in the hatch, mandibles extended. As McKenna watch -- Rory taps the code, the hatch SLAMS SHUT --
But the front half? Still alive, STILL MOVING -- CASEY AND MCKENNA BLAST IT TO TATTERS. As the thing finally, blessedly expires:
(CONT’D) (gasping) I hate spiders. If... if it happens again --
(nod, in unison:) Let’s call Mom.
Aftermath. A HAZE of smoke and debris hangs over the vacated ARK. Medics tend to the wounded.  105. McKENNA limps into view. Bee-lines to Traeger. Livid.
It was in there the whole time, you asshole. That was its goddamn PLAN!
Fool me twice, shame on me.
Where was it going? WHERE DID HE

That’s classified, Lieutenant. Before McKenna can respond with action, Traeger DRAWS HIS SIDEARM ON HIM; a twinkle in his eye. TRAEGER (CONT’ D) Kind of ironic, really. A trained sniper, dying from a headshot. BLAMM--! McKenna flinches as -- BLOOD spatters his face. A thousand-meter-a-second SNIPER ROUND just pierced TRAEGER’S HEAD. The guy drops, lifeless. SHIT. McKENNA spins, eyes tracking downrange -- Predator weapon--? Nope. M24 sniper rifle. GENERAL WOODHURST, comes into view, flanked by ARMY troop

Good riddance to bad rubbish. (NOTE: This is the General we saw on the phone with Traeg earlier.) He stops just shy of McKenna. Nods tersely: WOODHURST (CONT’D) Breathe easy, soldier. I’m on your side. CASEY, RORY and THE LOONIES step forward to join McKenna. Woodhurst regards them. Points to Rory, Casey, and Cutter
(CONT’D) You stay here. (looks up) The rest of you, come with me.  106. Casey puts a maternal hand on Rory’s shoulder. A reassuring look to McKenna: “I’1l take care of him.”
A Cape Canaveral-like launch facility abuts what looks like an animal habitat. Vast swampland beyond.
Woodhurst rides shotgun. McKenna and The Loonies in back, looking down at the facility below.
What am I looking at? Stargazer HQ?

(shakes his head) Stargazer was all Traeger. CIA black ops, corporate donors, all that shit. Wasn’t us. Off McKenna, stupefied: WOODHURST (CONT’D) Oh, yeah. Son of a whore went off the reservation. He was in it for profit. Practically stole that Predator for his little science experiments. He’s also the one who framed you. (beat) It’s not like I shot him just ‘cause I felt like it.
CASEY can’t help but eye THE SPACECRAFT curiously. Her army CHAPERONES, momentarily distracted; RORY nudges her, mischievous:
Wanna see what’s inside?
A BLAST of SOUND AND WIND as the TWO LAKOTA HELICOPTERS LAND inside chain link and razor wire marked with signs:  107.

Dust swirls as McKenna and the men jump out -- trade glan It isn’t just the SOLDIERS MOBILIZING, or even the 40mm a aircraft guns... It’s the urgency. Like they’re preparing a siege. Woodhurst leads them down some steps to
Half-in/half-out of the ground. GREEN BERETS at the entra
We don’t have time for security checks, just behave yourselves and we won’t have to shoot you.
What is this place?
“Area 52.” Base of operations.
For what?
Defending earth from the Predators. The doors YAWN OPEN, and --

Woodhurst leads the men down a long corridor lined with DISPLAY CASES: Predator SKELETONS; WEAPONS; BATTLE ARMOR. WOODHURST (CONT’D) They’ ve been coming here for years. Problem is, their m.o.’s changing. Dissension among the ranks. You saw it yourself -- that big one tore the other one in half. They reach a security checkpoint. Walk right through. WOODHURST (CONT’D) Luckily, we have some... “consultants” helping us. (a hard look Hope you boys are wearing your Depends... Hydraulic DOORS SLIDE OPEN TO REVEAL:  108.

Like you’d see at the zoo. But no lions, no tigers, no bears. Instead? Behind thick Plexi: TWO PREDATORS turn to look at our heroes. Same size as our “good” Predator. They blink curiously. WOODHURST (CONT’D) There’s a cold war going on, gentlemen. Seems it’s heating up. (re: Predators) These two... are defectors. Been here almost a year. McKenna, at a loss. No words. Finally manages:
They’re okay with... with being cooped up in there?

Oh, we let ‘em out at night. Game preserve, next door. They’re peace emmissaries but... hell, they’re still Predators, they’re gonna kill shit. He lights a cigar: WOODHURST (CONT’D) That first one you met? “Tiny?” (points to defectors) He was on their side. Stole the ark with those hybrids so the big fuck couldn’t use ‘em against us.
Whoa. You’re saying the first alien was... friendly?
Fuck that. The son of a bitch killed my men.
Hey, I never said he was a nice guy... just that he was on our side. Which brings us to the Big Bad -- (beat) Who, unless I miss my guess, is on his way here right now. With his “team.”  109.
But why? What’s his end game? Woodhurst shrugs:
Like I said. Cold war. (re: Predators) He came to kill these two. McKenna takes a moment. Looks up --
So, he’s... an assassin?
That’s right, Lieutenant. That thing out there’s an assassin. (icy glance) Just like you.

Say you’re right. It takes out its targets, then what? Without warning, ONE OF THE PREDATORS “talks”; its peculi throaty RATTLE of CLICKS over a scratchy P.A. speaker. An AIDE hands Woodhurst a device with a small LED screen. He keys it like a walkie-talkie, says:
Please repeat that. The Predator repeats with more emphasis. Woodhurst looks
A brief delay, we see: Searching... Searching... finally, a DIGITIZED VOICE issues from the device:
“Protocol 3. The synthetic will identify and procure most evolved opponent.” The words hang in the air a moment.
That’s the thing, see -- it won’t just leave. Not without souvenirs. (beat) It’s going to choose the strongest, most worthy adversary, and --  110.

(finishing the thought) -- and rips out its spine for the DNA, to take back home. (turns to Predator) Is that about the size of it..? The Predator SPEAKS AGAIN. Woodhurst looks at THE TRANSLA Searching... Searching... Searching...
VOICE “About size.”
A SENTRY PATROLS. Stops, and squints at: A four-legged ANIMAL, in silhouette. A coyote..? Now, ANOTHER ANIMAL joins the first: no legs here at all. Tentacles.
Mudbug One, we got BAMFs at the outside wire, WE GOT BAMFS AT TH-- WHOMP--!! ONE OF THE CREATURES TAKES HIM DOWN, DRAGS HIM. Nothing left after ten yards but slicks of blood and sine
Featuring the exterior: THE HYBRIDS, cutting through the perimeter sentries. Alarms start to WAIL, as
Looks on, McKenna and the others bathed in the ice-blue glow of the monitors. The General licks his lips, says:
Get ‘em outta here.
Who? Woodhurst points at the Predators in the enclosure.
Them. We’1l hold off the others ‘til you get away.
Away WHERE--?  111.

The SHIP, for Chrissakes. If you get them to the ship, they know how to fly it. His tone softens. Respectful. WOODHURST (CONT’D) Look, we’ve been watching you. You’re good at this. (beat) Just get ‘em to their ride. We’1l handle the bugs. McKenna and team don’t ask questions. They MOBILIZE. As Woodhurst calls after them: WOODHURST (CONT’D) I’m scrambling F-22'’s. Contact them once you’re in the air!

Lights FLICKER on and off, suggesting the Predators have attacked the central power system. Our heroes -- as well as the PREDATOR DEFECTORS -- GRAB WEAPONS from the display cases. McKenna stuffs them in a backpack: a Shuriken, a combistick, a biohelmet. He puts on the mask, looks at Williams.
(muffled) I feel like an idiot.
You look like an idiot.

VEHICLES come blasting up out of a tunnel, exiting the compound. A HIGH SPEED CONVOY, on the move. ARMY MOTORCYCLES. Behind them: JEEPS -- with pedestal- mounted machine guns. Imagine the Presidential motorcade but bristling with artillery. And IN THE CENTER of the convoy, the key vehic -- the one WILLIAMS is driving: AN M113 STRYKER ARMORED PERSONNEL CARRIER. McKenna, Baxley and Coyle are on top as well as, yes --  112.
Each armed with an M60 machine gun in one hand, a plasma- caster in the other. Ready to fight alongside our heroes.

Behind them, a continuous ROAR of gunfire -- the army ver the HYBRIDS, off-screen. Now, however, it becomes sporadi And then, rather suddenly, ceases altogether. WILLIAMS (CONT’D) Guess they took care of the bugs? One of the PREDATOR DEFECTORS utters some guttural CLICKS Williams consults the translator: Searching... Searching.
VOICE “Fornicate.”
looks toward the rear of the gauntlet. They’ve got compan
Incoming!
SCRAMBLE into view at high speed, picking up the scientis scent. Drooling mandibles, flashing eyes... Nightmare tim
ONTO the rear support jeep. Fanged. Clinging. A SOLDIER
The jeep JACK-KNIFES. The HYBRID leaps to the ground, THE GUNNER’S SKIN IN ITS MOUTH -- !

SCURRY behind the APC like racing dogs. THE LOONIES AND THE PREDATORS unload on them, but one manages to LEAP onto the back! Teeth gnashing. It FALLS OFF, but quickly regroups -- HURTLES back, but -- BRAKK! BRAKK! Surgical bullet hits. The thing BUCKLES. Plumes of GREEN BLOOD, as
hangs off the back of the APC with a SNIPER RIFLE, taking well-placed shots. Beside him:
Look at their necks, Chief! McKenna blinks. “What??”
(CONT’D) (pointing)
McKenna squints at:
And there, sure enough, something resembling COLLARS. McKenna raises the TRANSLATOR PAD; YELLS to the nearest Predator scientist:
The Predator BARKS and TRILLS between blasts. CLOSE ON TRANSLATOR: Searching... Searching...
“Self. Destruct.” McKenna, intense. Thinking quickly, he grabs the talkie from his belt, turns it on:
(into Bluetooth) Casey, it’s McKenna! Are you there? Do you have access to the ship?!
Casey and Rory, INSIDE THE SHIP.
(into Bluetooth; sheepish) Um..? She makes a face at Rory; “BUS-TED.”
Listen to me! The hybrids have some kind of self-destruct collars! Is there a way to --  114. Rory overhears this; GRABS Casey’s talkie, excited:
Dad, it’s me, I saw it! I saw the the program! The first Predator was trying to blow them up, but the sequence stopped.
Can you do it?
There was something about self- destruct in the file. The one Schaefer met in ‘87 left a pretty big hole.
These only have a ten-foot radius. We’re cool. Sort of. Casey turns, incredulous. Rory squirms, self-conscious:

(CONT’D) Maybe twenty. (beat) I, uh, saw it in the helmet. Suddenly paranoid, Casey YANKS THE SNIFFER’S COLLAR OFF - - HURLS IT out the open hatch. The Sniffer CHASES AFTER IT, playing fetch again. Casey WHIRLS -- sees RORY’S FINGERS, already tapping a CONTROL PANEL. She can’t fight the urge to smile.
He’s on it, McKenna.
McKenna watches the hybrids darting after them.
(into Bluetooth; tense) I have visual. Any time now would be great.
Rory hits keys, sweating. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Rory--?  115.
I know, I get it. I’m TRYING! CASEY looks around, frantic.
Too far. We must be out of range. (wit’s end) If only there was a way to MOVE this thing!
DARTING and WEAVING. Seemingly fixated on a single object
MCKENNA sees this, keys the translation device:

head_text.subj: WHY ARE THEY IGNORING THE OTHER

text: The Predator near him speaks: KLIK-RATTLE-KLIK! On the device: Searching... Searching...
VOICE “We are target.” OFF McKenna, the color draining from his face --
THE APC careens into view. HYBRIDS close on its heels.

as, from nowhere, a hybrid LEAPS -- TEARS HIS SKIN OFF. T body tumbles away... COYLE, next in line. He doesn’t go quietly. UNLOADS a volley of ammo in the creature’s FACE -- THE HYBRID CHEWS HIS SPINE OUT before it COLLAPSES, dead weight pressing down on Coyle’s ravaged corpse.
For the first time, he looks nervous. Glances down:
Showing the SPACE SHIP’S location. A quick glance tells us they are still a mile out.
(into Bluetooth) Hey, Lieutenant, you got a plan, or..?
And his face pretty much tells the tale: nope. Then he sp something new. In the distance behind them, but growing..
SPRINTING like a cheetah, in pursuit. CLOSING FAST. He sports TWO WRIST GAUNTLETS -- projectile arrows and CANNON. That’s it. Lean and mean.
Carnage, all around. He looks at the Predator defectors; SCREAMS into the translation device:
BLEAT OF CLICKS from the Predator. Searching... Searching
VOICE “Maybe not win.”
looks at the GPS display. Frowns. SEES the ship-blip is n MOVING TOWARD THEM.... WTF? Which is when:
falls over road. Blotting out the moon. Is it..? It is. THE ARK -- and it’s fucking AIRBORNE--!
Dwarfed by the massive “Captain’s chair”, RORY is now wea the Predator biohelmet, psychically linked to the technol He works the controls, spins to CASEY:
Taking her down... NOW.  117. Determined, he GRABS the control yoke. Just one problem
Landing this fucker ain’t easy. Plus it’s damaged, remember? The spacecraft BUCKS. WOBBLES --
CASEY, flung sideways. Goes sliding --
Are you trying to crash?? I thought you were some kind of genius, for chrissake!

I’M IN SPECIAL CLASS, OKAY? A sudden LURCH. The DESTRUCT console JERKS in her hands, and she blinks, registering: it moves. New idea. She GRABS THE CONTROL PANEL, hauls it loose -- and PROPEL it across the deck toward: AN ESCAPE POD. We saw the first Predator use one: at the start of the fi THE HATCH SLIDES DOWN, eclipses her from view
On it. Knows what to do, GRABS the control yoke, and
IT SWIVELS IN PLACE like a cannon, lining up, AIMING
CASEY sees a red button, SLAMS it, and WHOOOOSH--! LAUNCHES HERSELF. The pod goes airborne --

It tumbles... SLAMS DOWN! Traverses the length of the str INSIDE: CASEY’S JOLTED, SCREAMING, AS -- OUTSIDE: THE HYBRIDS watch the pod SCREAM PAST them, hesitate with confusion. That’s when WE SEE:  118. Tiny red LEDs on their collars are BLINKING... And now? One by one, before our eyes, THE HYBRIDS EXPLODE AS THE SPACECRAFT SKIDS PAST THEM -- like a string of

McKenna sees the sky behind them LIGHT UP from the detona hybrids. But his exhilaration is cut short as he notices: THE DEAD HYBRID on the top of the APC -- The LED on its collar is blinking now. Oh, shit. The TWO PREDATORS RAISE their wrist gauntlets -- THOOK! THOOK! LAUNCHING GRAPPLING HOOKS! Yank the corpse UP --

head_text.subj: AND HEAVE IT OFF THE APC

text: Like fishermen throwing a marlin back into the ocean. Williams puts the pedal to the metal: BA-WHOOM!! THE HYBRID EXPLODES, mid-air. At which point, not to be outdone -- Williams promptly CRASHES.
The APC PLOWS through chainlink, THROWING McKenna and the Predators off... and meanwhile, back at the ranch --

The hatch POPS OPEN... Casey half-crawls, half-TUMBLES out. Looks up, sweaty, feral -- ONE HYBRID LEFT. A weird, SATANIC looking thing, rushing straight at her -- It comes in range of the signal. BLOWS. She dives for COVER behind the pod. Bits of PREDATOR- THING, raining. A dismembered TORSO arcs down. Hits the tarmac. Turns to her, STILL ALIVE, REACHING -- She rips out its spine.  119. The SNIFFER lopes up beside her. A proud hunting dog... admiring its Huntress. An image to remember.
McKENNA and WILLIAMS, sprawled. Groggy. Ten yard-line of a high school FOOTBALL FIELD. Williams nods downrange:

Just past the fifty yard-line. Imbedded in the turf. AND THERE’S RORY Limping from the ship. Disoriented. McKenna starts toward him. His expression suggests that o he has the boy in his arms, he’s not likely to let go. At which point, the “DEFECTOR” PREDATORS RISE SLOWLY, throatily CLICKING... Grab their WEAPONS. Then? Everything goes to hell. Striding across the field THE UPGRADE. Big as life. Raises the GAUNTLET. Promptly spikes an ION BLAST through each of the smaller Predators; DISINTEGRATING them -- He BELLOWS victory: Mission Accomplished. Then PIVOTS. Mandibles twitching -- walks toward ITS CLOSEST REMAINING FOE, human or alien: The kid. The loser. “Ass Burger.” The Predator SCOOPS HIM UP in one hand -- regards him clinically, with something akin to... RESPECT? Turns, now And enters the downed spaceship. With Rory.

The HATCH SLAMS SHUT. McKenna stares in disbelief... then starts after them, the FULL meaning of this hitting him -- His son figured out how to fly the Ark; how to kill the hybrids. So what does that mean to the Upgrade? Only this RORY IS ITS MOST EVOLVED OPPONENT.  120.
As the Predator roughly TOSSES RORY INTO IT for safe keep Screens BLINK to life; a deep BASS RUMBLE is heard as the ship POWERS UP for departure.
As the spacecraft’s engines RUMBLE, and -- HE VAULTS up the bleacher steps--! Williams sees this. Trades a glance with Flyboy. They exchange “fuck it” shrugs, and HAUL ASS after him --

Plasma exhaust SPEWING, as McKenna SCRAMBLES up bleachers THE ARK, now fifteen feet below the top of the stadium... MCKENNA doesn’t slow. Runs, LAUNCHES into the air -- Touches down, WHACK--! ON TOP OF THE SHIP. He yelps in pain. ANKLE, twisted, and meanwhile --

Stand, looking down at him. Patiently wait as the top of the ship RISES EVEN WITH THEM -- STEP ON, like stepping onto an escalator. McKenna shoots them a withering look. That’s when the ship TURNS, throwing the three men off balance. THEY SCRAMBLE to find handholds --
LOCAL POLICE CARS, screaming into view, flashers turning. A MOTORCYCLE COP looks up, stunned. SEEING:
Over the treeline. He GRABS for his lapel mike -- but that’s the same moment handgun is LIBERATED FROM ITS HOLSTER, and he WHIRLS TO: CASEY, aiming his own sidearm at him.
You don’t want to do this, lady.  121.
There’s a lot of shit I don’t wanna do, Ponch. She mounts his Harley, ROARS OFF after the Predator ship.

Just in time for OUR VERTIGO SHOT -- as the ship ascends with our three soldiers hanging precariously. McKenna’s backpack SLIDES away -- He flails at it, the Predator weapons disgorging, tumbling earthward, fuck -- He hauls it in, secures it. Cups his ear, the one with th BLUETOOTH inside. YELLS into the com over the RUSHING WIN
Rory, I’m on top of the ship!! Are you okay?!
Safe in his coffin-like tube, Rory is shocked to hear his Dad. Puts his hand over his mouth so the Predator won’t h
Mom was right. You are crazy.

CASEY’s stolen chopper ROARS in pursuit of the spaceship. sees something by the side of the road, BRAKES abruptly-- The items that fell from the ship. Dented, scarred: A Predator BIOHELMET. A few feet beyond it, A CLOAKING BALL. Like the one McKenna used in Cuba.
Mid-air, Williams looks up, blanches. POINTS:
Uh-oh. On your six, chief! McKenna squints, seeing something on the horizon. Scratch that: TWO THINGS, on the horizon:
Closing fast. The ones Woodhurst scrambled. A SIDEWINDER LAUNCHES from one of them, AND --  122.
RORY, tense, peers from hiding at
depicting the incoming air-to-air missile. Then a blinkin DOTTED LINE begins to form, surrounding the ship. Rory ta his Bluetooth, FRANTIC:
Dad?? There’s a force field going online -- automatic!
Um -- say again?
Just... JUMP! STRAIGHT UP, NOW!
No time to argue, McKenna YELLS THE ORDER to his men:

What happens next, happens quickly. The force field DOES engage, but first, THREE THINGS: 1) McKENNA attempts to jump. STUMBLES. Falls FLAT. 2) WILLIAMS? He does jump. Straight UP, in fact. 3) FLYBOY, alas, does neither. He FREEZES, caught out, as

THE INVISIBLE FORCE FIELDS BLASTS ON with an ionized CRAC Now, let’s tally the result. First off -- MCKENNA is lying UNDER the field, which is just above him A LOCK OF HIS HAIR feathers down, clipped.
COMES DOWN, boots first, ON TOP of the force shield! Standing in mid-aid. Surreal. But sadly:
has been cut off at the knees. SEVERED, he topples away. His last flight.
Hanging on for dear life. Lies splayed, palms flat, separ from McKenna only by the force shield. Without it, they’d on TOP of each other.
BLASTS OVERHEAD: a MISS. Passes them and RIPS FORWARD int

Vanishes. Pause... DETONATION. Tower of FLAME. They’re going to pass right through it. McKenna, breathless, under the shields. Protected. Nebraska, not so much. They face each other through the barrier. Lock eyes; inches apart a moment before: NEBRASKA IS BURNED AWAY, flames engulfing the spacecraft.
The SECOND PILOT adjusts his HUD. LOCKS ON the Predator A
Two five-six, bogey’s in my sights, fangs out. Lighting up ‘winders... AN ALARM PIERCES: something’s wrong. The PILOT looks to his radar, shit, he’s being painted, as --
Hell, yeah. From the craft, an energy bolt LANCES UPWARD. Mere feet in front of McKenna, nearly INCINERATES him --
THE PILOT engages the ejection handle, and -- FWOOSH! Pilot and seat both ROCKET AWAY AS -- The ship DISSOLVES into flame beneath him.
SEEING the jet go to PIECES, high overhead. He looks around, desperation mounting. Has a nutty idea. He draws a gun, grips it tightly. Galvanizes, and --

ROLLS toward the edge, not stopping -- tumbles off the sh OVER THE FUCKING EDGE! We think it’s suicide. But nope: As long as he’s inside the shield, he can RIDE the fucker Which he DOES. Slewing. Tumbling down an invisible slide. CLUD--! Fetches to a stop. UNDERNEATH the craft. Florida blows by beneath him. The only thing that’s got h back, utterly INVISIBLE. He decides not to look down. Fixates OVERHEAD, instead, on: THE EXPOSED SHIP’S BELLY. More specifically--? The EMPTY PORT where an escape pod once nestled. He wrest his way inside, clinging to a strut. Sees a keypad, YELLS
RORY! What’s the sequence?? I watched you put it in, TELL ME!
Rory HEARS this, stammers:
To the pod?? I... I can’t remember.
Okay, do this -- TRY.
I can’t think, it’s mixed up in my head --

Dammit, son, I watched you! It was one, two, then over three, up two... McKenna stops. Blinks. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Holy shit. I fucking KNOW it. He begins frantically stabbing away at the entry pad. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Rory? You know how I always said be a big boy?
Yeah?  125.
Screw it. Make yourself small, kid. (beat)
The hatch slides back -- McKenna UNLOADS, shot after shot. Targeting any BLINKING LIGHTS. BLAZES AWAY. Teeth bared, fearsome --

The ship SHUDDERS violently as -- THE PREDATOR whips around in his seat, ALARM KLAXONS PEALING. Registers the OPEN DOOR; a visitor. Doesn’t miss beat. Raises an arm, FIRES -- McKENNA, BLOWN BACKWARD THE BLAST knocks him loose. Sends him TUMBLING backward into open air -- And we say “open air” because even as the energy shield catches him, high over Florida, we can see it’s FLICKERING. Like a bulb before it goes out -- And then, it goes out. McKENNA DROPS. Like a stone, even as
Begins descending. Pitching, yawing --
But faster. PLUMMETING, a thousand feet in the air. SEES:
Billowing. THE EJECTED PILOT from the first F-22. MCKENNA ADJUSTS COURSE in mid-air; SLAMS into the guy, an -- GRABS HOLD, breaking his fall, as
PIERCES the trees, SKIMS ACROSS brackish water -- HURTLES INTO a fallen willow, CRACK--!
The VIEW PORT explodes outward. Predator, EJECTED..!  126. Exits, pinwheels through space... Disappears into the BOG. Vanishes, submerged. The ship subsides, comes to rest in...
Primitive. Primordial. What the world was like before the dinosaurs. Silence...
CRASHES DOWN--! Through the branches. Breaking ribs, tearing skin. Tossed like a rag doll, until --
He JERKS TO A HALT, hanging in a tree branch twenty feet off the ground. Much like when we met first him. Unconscious PILOT, strapped beside him. McKenna takes stock. Looks down, at
RISING from the swamp. Back hunched; shards peppering its flesh. Rivulets of phosphorescent green blood...
It’s down to the two of them. McKenna doesn’t waste a second. He’s already unlimbered h sniper rifle and he DOUBLE-TAPS the trigger, puts TWO IN ITS CHEST. And from there..? It never stops.
BELLOWS..! Stumbles back, collides with the downed ARK. P a hand out to STEADY itself, grips the craft -- Mistake.
RORY LEAPS to the console. Finds a flickering button, POU it with his tiny fist -- And just like that, triggers the FORCE SHIELDS.

The Predator looks down, goggles --  127. Noting the neatly cauterized STUMP where its forearm was. The limb DROPS AWAY as the Predator looks on, dumbly. McKENNA, MEANWHILE Drops..! ROLLS -- comes up running. BLASTING shots at the creature. Dives behind a tree... And blinks. Because righ in front of him, incongruously: A MOTORCYCLE. Just lying there. He snaps his gaze upward, hearing trees move -- seeing NOTHING -- as, without warning

Shimmers and MATERIALIZES BEFORE OUR EYES. Launches, snarling, from an OVERHEAD TREE BRANCH. Onto the Predator’s shoulders..! She grabs a fistful of DREADLOCKS. SLICES THEM CLEAN OFF- THE PREDATOR STAGGERS and WEAVES. Disoriented. CLAWING blindly at the air. MCKENNA tosses his rifle -- pulls the COMBISTICK -- Here we go. The final flurry:
SWATS McKENNA aside. CASEY, sent tumbling. Then the Predator SPINS, startled -- struck by THREE BULLETS, as

head_text.subj: HOLY FUCK, THE GUY IN THE TREE

text: The PILOT, has removed his Sig-Sauer from his nylon vest and, still strapped in, starts RAINING COVER FIRE --
Triggers an ION BLAST. Blows the tree to splinters. Obliterates him. DEBRIS showers down. McKenna, scrambling...

UNLOADS. Looses a veritable FIRESTORM. Triggers BLAST AFTER BLAST, churning up water, SHREDDING trees -- Our heroes can do nothing but duck and cover.  128. They’re no match. CASEY is blown six feet through the air HITS, rattled, and it’s all over -- heroes, done. EXCEPT: Now, above the din, a SOUND intrudes upon Casey’s consciousness. Subtle at first, she squints -- Now WE hear it -- a heavy PANTING off-camera, as

PADS INTO VIEW. Something in its mouth. IT DROPS IT at Casey’s feet; an offering. CASEY’S POV: THE SELF-DESTRUCT COLLAR. The one she threw away earlier. It fetched it back. At which point, everything proceeds like a BLUR: Casey, no hesitation. She scoops it up, feverishly accessing buttons on her WRIST GAUNTLET -- Across the clearing, McKENNA sees this, yells: MCKENNA (CONT’D) TOSS IT. She doesn’t ask questions. Slings it. Across the clearing to McKENNA -- who SNAGS it from air, just in time to DIVE Narrowly misses being INCINERATED -- He hits, ROLLS -- comes up in a combat crouch; HAVING RETRIEVED THE PREDATOR’S SEVERED ARM. The one with the arrows. He loops the COLLAR over the double-pronged PROJECTILES. Pivots, AIMS as --
Triggers the last two digits in the arming code: The LED BLINKS RED. McKenna FIRES; takes the creature in the leg. IMBEDS. Pause...

HURLS THE PREDATOR backward--! Red smoke and flames subsi revealing...  129. A FIFTEEN FOOT CRATER. Smoking. Seething... in the midst of it, the PREDATOR, a bloodied green mess. Writhing... barely alive. McKENNA and CASEY stagger forward, Casey in battle mode

Staggers out of the downed ARK... rushes to his father’s side. They embrace, but McKenna’s eyes never leave the Predator; rifle at the ready. Cautiously, he reaches in his pack. Brings out the TRANSL DEVICE. Keys it...
(to The Predator) Who are you..? What are you? The Predator, half-conscious, “answers” with its trademar rattle of TRILLS AND CLICKS. Searching... Searching...
VOICE “I... warrior.” (beat) “You?” McKenna trades looks at Rory. A shrug. Not resigned, but. maybe a hint of pride?
Same. The creature points at RORY.

“Warrior... NEW breed.” That’s bizarre. For a moment we’d swear it’s favoring the kid with a FOND LOOK, one of admiration -- Then it GOES for the kid. The last of its strength, LASHES OUT, talons bared --
Puts two SHOTS THROUGH ITS EYE. The Predator slumps. Dead. McKenna’s eyes shift to his son, spattered in green blood. Staring.  130.
Sorry.
That’s okay. You can shoot him again if you want.
I’m good. A COMMOTION, NOW, they turn their gaze skyward, as
HUEYS come ratcheting in, CIRCLING the clearing. SOLDIERS, rappelling down through TREE TOPS --
Touches down, immediately sprinting for the three SURVIVORS, forming a makeshift perimeter --

And the slobbering PREDATOR DOG pads into view. Bee-lines to Casey, panting for her favor. EVERY MILITARY WEAPON SWIVELS to draw a bead on it. But like an Amazon warrior, Casey divests the nearest soldier of his weapon. Spins, COCKS IT -- !
You touch my dog and I’11 kill you. One of the soldiers RUNS up to them.
Lieutenant McKenna? The soldier hands him a cell phone. McKenna puts the phone to his ear, perplexed. Then... a relieved smile, and he hands the phone to his son.
(into phone) Mom? EXT. RORY’S HOUSE - DAY (INTERCUT:) EMILY, on the front porch. Clutching a phone:  131.
Are you okay, honey? His answer, drowned out by the ROAR OF A CHOPPER descendi EMILY (CONT’D) What’d you say, peanut? Rory plugs his ears. SHOUTS:
Ich liebe auch tou! But still, no good. The helicopter, deafening.
Now the chopper DIES DOWN... just in time for us to hear:
I love you. TIME CUT: MINUTES LATER - ON CASEY AND McKENNA Approaching the helicopter.
It’s weird. The file was all about how honorable these things are... (re: upgrade) But this one -- he wasn’t about hunting. No sporting chance, nothing. Just slaughter.
You said it yourself, it had human DNA... (smiles sadly) They’ re becoming more like us.
(unsettled) McKenna, did we... did we just start a war? Now, a VOICE from the chopper:
Negatory. The war’s already started. They both look up as, framed in the hatchway, REVEAL:  “DUTCH” SCHAEFER The Predator’s first adversary. Face haunted;
Dutch Schaefer, U.S. Special Forces. Come with me.
Uh... me, too? Schaefer nods, smiles grimly... says:
Especially you. CUT TO BLACK. CREDITS. 132. etched by pain.
